description:
Wow, what a great experience. I got here quite early for dinner around 5:30 and the restaurant was pretty empty. I sat at the bar and, while waiting for my boyfriend who was stuck in traffic, decided to start with an order of agedashi tofu - this was delicious and a great start to the meal. At this time one of the chefs also approached me and kindly told me to take my time with the menu and let him know if I have any questions. My boyfriend and I then ordered a variety of items:

-Chawanmushi: light flavor, love the uni on top, a little small for the price (3.5/5) 
-Miso Grilled Cod: amazing flavor and beautiful texture, again a little small (4/5)
-Scallop/Uni/Monkfish/Quail Egg Spoons: such a great value and absolutely delicious as well, remember to eat it as one whole bite to get the full experience!! the monkfish especially was amazing! (5/5)
- Engawa Nigiri: thiswas the only one that was seared and  was nice and fatty; to be honest, I enjoyed this more than the o-toro (5/5)
- Shima Aji Nigiri: probably my least favorite out of the bunch, but this is mostly due to personal preference, this one was a bit more firm in texture (3/5)
- Young Yellowtail Nigiri: fresh and tasty (3.5/5) 
- O-toro Nigiri: melt in your mouth !!! (4.5/5)
- Amaebi Nigiri: so nice and sweet, one of my favorites (5/5) 
- Hokkaido Scallop Nigiri: also super sweet !! (5/5)
- Sea Eel Nigiri: i'm used to having the barbecue one but this one is even better, though a light bit sweeter (5/5)
- Soba w/ Tempura: the tempura were perfectly crisp and the soba still had a great bite! The broth was a little salty for my taste but was fine for my boyfriend (3.5/5) 

Overall, I really enjoyed this meal and can't wait to come back to try more nigiri!
author: Janice L.

description:
Cherry blossom, unagi avocado, spicy tuna 

Akira seems like it's located on a quieter street off of a busy street, but don't let that fool you: there'll probably be a wait when you go, but it will be worth it! 

I love how they give you hot towels to start off the meal. I haven't seen that in a while at Japanese restaurants? 

The service is very warm and friendly, knowing that you may grow impatient waiting. I tried the Cherry Blossom, Unagi Avocado, and Spicy Tuna rolls. They were all very good and had complex flavors so they weren't like when I've had these rolls at other restaurants in the past. 

Solid place for a date or girls' night out, its intimate and modern ambiance that can be romantic. 

The bathroom is very nice, reminds me kind-of of Equinox? Not that I'm a member there haha. 

Anyways, Akira is definitely my new go-to sushi spot in the area. Better than most places I've been in Japantown. Good value.
author: Lizzie S.

description:
First impression
When you first walked in the place smelled like fish.
Then you see a sign on the wall saying fish is flown in daily from Japan. This may be the case or it could be flown in frozen.

staff 
Really nice and helpful with menu

Food
Not fresh tasting & the rice was hard on the specialty rolls.

The squid app was really boring & the poke bowl was practically a salad with barely any tuna. Super weird.

I took three stars off for lackluster culinary experience and poor quality fish.
author: Vanessa R.

description:
Fresh sashimi and nigiri for the win here! 

I adored their spoonfuls of sashimi delights!

Truffle hamachi carpaccio was bomb and I couldn't get enough. It complimented well with the cold and refreshing white wine!

They have sushi rolls and other delightful dishes.

Modern seating and ambiance!

Attentive staff.

Spot on win!
author: Tiffany D.

description: Short review: Akira is a small sushi restaurant at the south-eastern order of Lower Pacific Heights that is a casual sushi restaurant without the pretension or exorbitant prices that plague the majority of sushi restaurants here in San Francisco. Perhaps it's this normalcy and quality fish that has earned it such acclaim here on Yelp but I generally agree with the praise this restaurant has received. Fish tasted fresh, no one in my group had unexpected bathroom troubles in the subsequent days, and the rolls were well adorned and delicious.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Awesome place!   Highly recommend this nice neighborhood Japanese restaurant.  Had a great meal before heading over to the AMC Van Ness for an evening movie.   

Started with a couple different Japanese craft beers.  Both light, yet flavorful.  Have not seen these before so probably hard to find.

Instead of choosing from a large menu we shared a omakase tasting menu and had a couple of add ons to fill our little tummy's.   Each dish was fresh and delicious.  Highlights include the tuna belly, fresh abalone, fried cod, and mochi ice cream at the end. Sat at the bar so fun to watch the sushi chef in action throughout the meal. 

Atmosphere is nice and quiet.  Great for a first date or 100th date for sure.
author: Marcus K.

description:
This place is a hidden gem! It has a small, quaint atmosphere that's pretty laid back. The service was excellent and I appreciated the small talk that Andre, my server, and I had. I ordered seaweed salad, a dragon roll, green tea cheesecake, and roasted rice tea. All the food was amazing but hands down the dragon roll was some of the best sushi I've had! I definitely would recommend that you check them out if you're in the area. I will be coming back for sure!

I love this place, I come every few months and the sushi chef remembers me. I appreciate them.
author: Christopher W.

description:
Akira is a nice little intimate sushi restaurant. Came here with a party of 5 and seating is pretty limited but they managed to squeeze us in. I saw this spot have great reviews on Yelp and wanted to try it for myself. My opinion? Some of the best sashimi in SF! They have a very small selection of non fish items so expect to order sashimi or rolls here.

I ordered the chirashi don which is sashimi over rice. The sashimi was extremely fresh and tasty. I believe the types are chef's decisions but there was a good variety including tuna, salmon, shrimp, tamago, egg, octopus, and mackerel. Didn't care for the octopus but tuna, salmon, and mackerel were fantastic. Texture was amazingly tender. The rice had a great sweet vinegary taste with tiny slivers of nori. Portion wasn't huge but I walked away feeling satisfied.

Service was friendly and accommodating, food came out quick, and prices are reasonable. Highly recommend if you like sushi!

Food: 4.75/5
Value: 4/5
Service: 4/5
Overall: 4.5/5
author: Brian G.

description:
Aggressively mediocre. I ordered a cup of miso, some unagi nigiri, and a dragon roll. The miso was fine, but both the unagi and the dragon roll did not taste flavorful at all, and the dragon roll tasted like the rice was burnt. This was probably the most disappointing sushi I've ever had, and I've had my fair share - especially for the price. To top it off after I finished my food, I wanted to try ordering some other rolls - because hey, maybe I just got unlucky with the ones I chose. I proceeded to try and catch the eye of one of the numerous waitresses in the small establishment for 15 minutes, menu in hand. No such luck. Eventually I just interrupted a waitress as she was walking by and asked for my check.

Mediocre food, mediocre service. Thoroughly unimpressed.
author: James T.

description:
My girlfriend and I were so excited to splurge a bit on the omakase deal ($65) here at Akira. It was definitely not bad, but it was underwhelming. Everything seemed like it was close to being great, but came up just a bit short. Pictures of all the omakase dishes are attached--keep in mind this review is solely based on the omakase, but typically I find omakase is a good indicator for the rest of the food at the restaurant. 

Recommendations: Nigiri was the highlight of the omakase set

Pros: Service was friendly, green tea was satisfying, ambience was great for a date night, Nigiri

Okays: Cod was the perfect texture, but overly oily. 

Cons: Price that we paid for the rest of the omakase pieces
author: Perry H.

description:
Pro:
- Friendly staff.
- No need to wait for seats.
- Oysters shooters.

Cons:
- Slow sushi service 20min for 2 simple rolls & nigiri.
- Bad rice; falls apart.
- uni only gave you in little pieces. Most people fills up the nigiri.
- Vietnamese sushi chef so probably not Omakase worthy.

2nd time here but probably last time. Nothing special. Unless you love close by and want something quick.
author: Molinda S.

description:
I don't mind paying more for good food. But I do mind being blatantly ripped off. 

I paid $40+ for $5 worth of food. Literally couldn't pick up my sashimi without it falling apart. See picture. The quality seemed high but I couldn't really tell because the slices were so thin. 

Ate probably 5% eel and 95% cucumber rice and avocado in my caterpillar roll. 

If you want a good spot for a date, come here. The ambiance is great for that. Otherwise better options out there. I think I will need a redemption meal at Tenroku at Japan town.
author: Renee L.

description: Had a fantastic meal with my coworkers at Akira. Chefs choice of sashimi was great, rolls were also fantastic. I would however skip the Akira roll next time, but am not disappointed that I tried it. Did not realize it would be wrapped in cucumber rather than rice. The restaurant is not very large, it had a very nice atmosphere.
author: Damien M.

description:
Arrived early for what I thought was a 7 p.m. reservation on Friday; whoops! I'd made it for Saturday by mistake; in addition, my date was late. The host was able to fid me a table for two and, when my friend arrived and wanted a quieter table, the restaurant accommodate us. That put them ahead from the start.

Then the fact that there were three Japanese beers that I'd not seen before, always a bonus and my friend knew she wanted to try a special appetizer: tuna tartare. Delicisously subtle flavours of tuna with avocado and a little sesame. Since there were several fishes I don't often get to eat, and she's not a big rice fan, we proceeded to order nigiri: mackerel, bream, halibut, salmon. That left room for one more so we had the tuna. Each was fresh, not seasoned and very  tasty.

I'd hoped for som egreen tea icecream and left room for it but there ws one. We settled for the green tea cheesecake, and I have to reveal, it was a bit too dry.

Didn't spoil a great meal that lasted three hours 9servers weren't hurrying us at all, despite my reservation snafu) so I highly recommend this place.
author: Michael A.

description:
This was a very tasty experience. We had the Hamachi Carpaccio which was awesome. The combined flavors of the Hamachi, Ponzu, Avocado and Mango was on point. 
As for the sushi/sashimi, the fish was fresh and the rolls such as the Caterpillar and Spicy Mango were great, with not too much rice to take away from the freshness and flavor of the fish.
author: Ralph R.

description: Based on Yelp reviews, we made a reservation for 4 at 8:30PM. When we arrived, our table was waiting and we were seated right away. We had to try the ankimo quail egg scallop spoon which we liked. We ordered Dinner Omakase, Eel Donburi, Nabeyaki Soba, Chawanmushi, Seaweed salad. Of the Omakase dishes, the sushi was good. Soup, not so much. The presentation was lovely. Service was good.  Mochi ice cream was just right. If you are in a hurry, skip Omakase. This small restaurant was packed and the noise level was above average with people talking.
author: Selina Y.

description:
I literally had to write this review right after I left because I wanted the experience to be fresh in my mind! 

First off: omakase, omakase, omakase!

Everything about this place was on point. We were quickly seated, service was fast and prompt and attentive. The servers refilled our waters and teas all the time and the dishes came out perfectly one after the other with no delay. They were incredibly friendly and helpful.

The sushi was amazing! We ordered the omakase and every part of it was delicious. From start to finish, we were definitely impressed and very full afterwards! 

Another thing I noticed while I was eating that speaks much to how great they are: customers were coming in that were being greeted like old friends, "Hi! Sit down sit down, where's Paul today?" said the sushi chef to a young lady just ordering take-out. Another group of people came in and the super friendly sushi chef knew them too! Clearly this is a regular go-to spot for locals and the chef makes an effort to get to know everyone personally. That left such a positive impression on me.

We will have to comeback regularly as well!
author: Peggy C.

description: Akira Restaurant is delicious! The restaurant itself is cute,  very clean and full of friendly staff waiting to serve you. They are very attentive and super quick. We ordered the lunch bento box with Chicken Katsu that was the best Katsu I've had in San Francisco. The miso soup was perfect and the dressing they use on their salad is full of flavor. We had the California Roll to start with and it tasted so fresh and yummy. We will recommend Akira to all friends and family visiting! Thank you!
author: Alice B.

description:
Walked by this place a couple of times and saw that it was packed each time. I came here with my family for dinner on a week night. It's a cozy restaurant with maybe only 25 seats. My mother order the omakase set and I got to try a bit of everything. It took awhile for the omakase appetizer to come out. They had already served main courses to my dad and brother before she got her appetizer. The appetizer came in a dish separated into 3 compartments which had squid, jellyfish and octopus. The sashimi (tuna and salmon) and the nigiri that came with the omakase were excellent. There were 2 soups that came with it as well as a grilled butterfish that was a little bit too burnt. One soup was a winter melon soup and the other soup which came with the nigiri was the red miso soup. I didn't care for either. For the omakase dessert, you could pick either ice cream, an assortment of mochi ice cream or a green tea cheesecake. We got the mochi ice cream which came in 3 flavors mango, strawberry and green tea. 
For an omakase, the pricing ($65)  is pretty good compared to other restaurants' omakases. The plating and presentation were all very beautiful. However I think your money is better spent on getting the sashimi or nigiri which are very reasonably priced and delicious.
author: Vivian C.

description: It was my first time to eat the Japanese food. I was little scarred and indifferent to the Japanese culture. But my friend taught me how to start and I really enjoyed the dish. One of the best places for delicious food. We ordered sashimi and rolls and they were so fantastic. Thanks for the great service to the newer Japanese food.
author: Mamta B.

description:
Decent prices and rolls. I definitely would go here more often if I was closer. It's upscale enough for a casual date, but not too overly priced (relative to the city). 

Service: prompt and courteous. I liked the waiters and their input. They asked which table we wanted since they weren't too busy (6 on a Tuesday) and I wanted to sit near the window. The table was right by the door though and I was freezing. Only thing I would change ;(. 4/5

Food: tons of flavor and fish was fresh. My favorites were the negi toro and the mango topped roll. Usually I prefer negi hama but their tuna was definitely superior in flavor. The spicy mango roll also wasn't spicy (good for me). All the ingredients were fresh, rice was well cooked and seasoned, and we gobbles everything up. 4.5/5

I will absolutely go back and can't wait to try more items!
author: Anna N.

description: Fresh fish, warm ambiance and staff, minimalist wooden and blue decor-- Akira is my neighborhood favorite. Also, their seasonal pumpkin roll and their sake avocado roll are both perfect.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Great service. Great ambiance. Really really great sushi

Delicate flavors. Fresh fish. High end. Yummmmmmmy
author: Mike G.

description:
We are stranded in SF overnight. United sucks but that's another review.
Food is top shelf and so is Felix, our waiter. Waiter isnt really the right word for him.. he is more of a conductor and the chefs are the orchestra! We told Felix to just bring out some dishes. This is a picture of cod liver, uni, quail egg in a homemade ponzu sauce.. we had jellyfish, pickled horseradish root, fried lotus leaves with crab ceviche- are you understanding this??!  It was an awesome meal that turned our over night stay without our luggage in to a culinary event! We ended it with black sesame ice cream with a meringue around it- like how does one Do that?! We are so happy on this rainy night!! Love Felix, Love Akira! Go, right now.. or maybe tomorrow since we closed the place down just now ;)
author: Tami R.

description:
Came here on Saturday evening for a quick dinner before watching a movie at the AMC Theater on Van Ness. We walked in without reservations and were immediately seated at the bar. I loved the ambiance of this restaurant and find it great for 1 on 1 dinners! 

For 2 people we ordered the Chirashi Bowl, Rainbow Roll, Pink Dragon Roll, and Sake Bombs. It was definitely a lot of food for 2 people but we were able to finish everything since everything tasted divine! The Chirashi Bowl had generous portions of fresh fish and really melts in your mouth after every bite. The rolls were also excellent and I highly recommend ordering the Pink Dragon Roll!

We also ordered Sapporo and Sake which was pretty affordable! $7 for a large Sapporo and $9 for a 9 ounce hot Sake! Overall I would definitely come back if I'm looking to get my sushi fix. The staff was really friendly and I really like how intimate the setting here is!
author: MyTien P.

description: Akira is my favorite sushi place in SF!! I literally had no idea this existed until I stumbled upon it on my walk in the neighborhood. Every time we go for dinner, the staff here is so sweet and friendly. Food has never failed to satisfy and it's almost as if you're dining in their home. Hooked! Go!
author: Michelle M.

description:
The chirashi here is only $20 but it's pretty good. No crazy gimmicks, but the right amount of portion size and pretty good tasting sashimi. The sushi rice could obviously be better but for $20, I don't expect much anyway.

Quality is good. Don't expect toro, uni, scallops, etc. But it does its job! I highly recommend this place if you're hungry and just want a quick, easy, "cheap" chirashi bowl
author: Sang P.

description:
Sushi bar review.

Ordered:
Toro tartare with quail egg
Kama shioyaki (shio rare duck)
Rainbow roll
Black spider roll (larger soft shell crab, black tobiko, unagi sauce)
Pink dragon roll (shrimp tempura, avocado, albacore, garlic chips, ponzu)

Score - 2

Overall, "I've experienced better."
author: Mark O.

description:
3.5/5
Was in the neighborhood for lunch and decided to give this place a shot. First off the service is very nice and parking is pretty easy (at least on a weekday). 

For my meal I got the chirashi ($19) and one of the daily specialty rolls (salmon belly outside, crab inside- $14). The chirashi is pretty small and reminds me of the one at Sanraku. The pieces of fish are thin (in a good way) but wide. The selection was pretty typical (1 piece each of maguro, hamachi, tako, escolar, saba, albacore, ebi + 2 tamago). The tamago had good sweetness though wasn't very well made. Rice was very well flavored though which was a huge plus. Quality of the fish is decent.

The roll was very disappointing though. The crab gets kind of washed away by the salmon, spicy mayo, and jalapeno. The salmon belly itself was thin and not very flavorful. Definitely not worth the $14. 

Overall, Akira is a decent sushi spot. I'd still consider coming back but I definitely will steer clear from the rolls in the future.
author: Vivian C.

description: Akira is a great place to check out if you are looking for great Japanese food in the area. Akira is a little more upscale than what you will find in Japan town, and with that being said is a great place to come on a date or a special occasion. The fish they use on their sushi is top notch and melts in you mouth, and you are able to order sushi and get a bottle of wine for an affordable price. I would recommend getting a reservation if you are coming for dinner during regular so if hours, especially on the the weekends. With that being said though, definitely worth checking out Akira
author: Ross S.

description: Yum!!! Delicious / authentic Japanese food/sushi. I waited around 20-25 to get a table because the place is extremely small and busy. The service was really slow because they only had one waitress so we waited 30ish to get our sushi. The fish was fresh and the ikura was absolutely sweet and delicious. I'll come back in a month or two !
author: Amy C.

description:
Thank god for Akira. Out of all the sushi spots in my neighborhood, Akira's by far my favorite. Technically, it's not even my neighborhood but I'll walk the extra distance - Akira is well worth it. 

I've been here twice and was impressed both times. My usual is the chirashi which has a wide variety of fish and is really filling for $19. 

I tried their ankimo, hotate, quail egg, and uni spoons during my last visit and it was AMAZING - a perfect marriage of flavors in one bite. Truly heavenly. Don't miss out on this one. 

So happy I found Akira and no longer have wander far to satisfy my sushi cravings! Service is great and the sushi chefs are friendly which is a plus and makes for a more enjoyable experience!
author: Laverne N.

description: So this place was just awesome! The problem with yelp is people have an "issue" and come up with an excuse to not give a stellar rating. Weed out the bad people and judge appropriately. Awesome experience at an awesome price!
author: Michael S.

description: In Washington, D.C. or elsewhere, I'd give this place at least four stars. In a sushi heavy town like SF, it's a very solid--even excellent--neighborhood sushi joint. Service is good, the fish is fresh and the quality of sushi craftsmanship is high. There isn't much unusual on the menu and it probably isn't worth a special trip. But it's fancy enough to offer an omakase menu...pretty good all-in-all. If you're in the neighborhood, stop by for sure.
author: Eli L.

description: A true gem. It's got a hot spot sushi bar , just the right amount of date night tables & a comfortable local restaurant vibe beautifully put together. Judy & Minh run this cozy space. They're what SF community is all about, they're a hard working couple raising two great kids. The regular menu has more than a few unique treats on it that make it stand out as something special. They keep the specials interesting. The deal breaker however is the quality. This is craft Sushi. Made & presented with Love. Beautiful fresh produce, every time. A true gem. I recommend without reservation, but also recommend you make one.
author: Susan C.

description:
Decent neighborhood sushi spot (and very popular too!). Be prepared for a wait -- the place is small but usually very very full (even on weekday nights) and there are only two guys behind the counter working as fast as they can. 

Tried the shooters, various nigiri (ran out of hokkaido uni though :( so had santa barbara instead), and some rolls. Fish was decently good quality, but not the highest. I think i've been spoiled by the Bay and Seattle area offerings.

This is (almost) your typical American sushi bar -- not traditional and not focused on omakase. We learned that they don't put wasabi on *any* of the nigiri by default because folks kept complaining about not liking it. Really? That tells me that the average diner here aren't looking for an 'enjoy-the-fish' experience. I saw lots and lots of rolls being prepared. 

Though we're a block away, unfortunately we won't be making this our regular spot. Happy to leave it (and the 45 min wait) for the usual customers to enjoy.
author: Jennifer M.

description: Decent sushi! At first, the waiter came off extremely rude and standoffish, but he slowly warmed up and turned out to be friendly/funny. I wouldn't say it's the best sushi I've tried, but it was definitely a good experience. I just wish it was a bit closer to everything - after I finished eating lunch here, I Uber'ed to the Japan Center and got some dessert there!
author: Angelina H.

description: Excellent service, very attentive... I love the quaint little atmosphere they have here... this is a gem downtown, definitely a must try if you're in the neighborhood.
author: Nathan D.

description: Akira is a GREAT local neighborhood spot. It is classy enough to entertain business partners but not so stuffy that you are signing up for a 3 hours situation. Their a la carte menu is fantastic as is their omakase without breaking the bank. Their sushi quality is not quite as high end as places like Wako etc but their prices are super reasonable and their sushi is good! Also, their style of cooking is more laid back. I LOVE their miso black cod, it is absolutely to die for. I also love their uni dishes. Would highly recommend. Also the owners are SUPER nice!
author: Jocelyn K.

description:
Review is only for their weekday lunch time Shokado bento!

For $17, you are served so many delicious and well cooked goodies, including tempura, delicious sashimi (salmon and walu!), perfectly broiled fish, pickles, nimono (a simmered dish), miso soup, and of course, rice.

It didn't look like too much food to begin with, since all of the portions were pretty small, but it ended up being more than enough. Definitely a good bang for your buck, and so much more satisfying that the teriyaki chicken bento boxes you get at other places!

will be back for weekday lunch!
author: Michelle L.

description: The wasabi squid is good. We loved it with the beer! Santa Babra Uni is great. Hokkaido Uni is a bit 微妙... hummmm  ただ普通...?
author: Emilie G.

description:
Amazing service. Delicious food. Great value.  
Walked in at 5:30pm on a Friday night and we're just lucky enough to catch a perfect table by the window.  Our server was very knowledgeable and kind. Appetizers, sake, and rolls were very well prepared and presented.  Thank you for a great meal!  Definitely a new favorite spot in SF!
author: Hungry M.

description:
A sushi place with delectable reviews in a less than 5 min walking radius?!! Down! 
The hubs and I came to Akira on a casual Thursday night when we were just a bit too lazy to cook dinner.
Having planned this earlier in the day, I made a reservation ahead by calling the restaurant (they no longer take OpenTable reservations). Seemingly, tonight a reservation was not needed, though we have seen the restaurant bustling with people on the weekends.
Quickly seated, we ordered ourselves hot sake, tempura, and miso soup. We put in our roll orders too, a spicy mango roll and an Akira roll, assuming it would take some time. Boy were we wrong! 
Service was so quick! We had our beautiful rolls sitting in front of us minutes before our appetizers arrived. 
Mildly overwhelmed, we worked our way through the warm miso and the crunchy tempura, excited to start the main event...
The mango roll was tasty, the mango adding an exotic touch. Only downside was the rice felt a little too... squishy? Smooshy?
The Akira roll was divine!!!! On a health kick, the hubs and I kept evaluating how it is such a simple and HEALTHY roll- cucumber and fish! Definitely coming back for this one!
Location, service, and food rocked our boats! We'll be back!
author: Roma R.

description: New fave sushi in (almost) my neighborhood. Unusual dishes like the Uni Spoon (amazing) and abalone nigiri (ok) set it apart. Lots of special fish flown in from Japan, excellent service, big selection and reasonable prices for this quality. Already planning to walk a few blocks further because it's better than our current go-tos closer to home.
author: Robin W.

description: Awesome! Awesome! Awesome! First awesome, the service. So friendly. Bend over backwards to make you happy. If you interact with the waitress and chefs they will talk with you like you're family. Second awesome, the fish. So fresh that it melts in your mouth. Third awesome, atmosphere. 8 sushi bar seats and maybe 8 tables. Can't wait to go back.
author: Eric C.

description:
Tried the Omakase, the oyster/quail egg/uni shooters and anago for dinner and this place is good. The omakase is really fantastic value ($65) but it's not the traditional sushi Kaiseki that you would get from places like Kusakabe.  The highlights of the meal are the miso black cod, the anago, the shooters and the black sesame ice cream. 

Service was outstanding and this is a really good upper end neighborhood sushi place. I'm really glad I found it.
author: Andrew S.

description:
Great Japanese!
The fish is very good and fresh. We were seating at the bar and everything was prepared in front of us.
On top of it the price was right!
It's definitely a good spot you must try.
author: Thibault L.

description: This restaurant has very quickly become my go-to sushi spot! Their spicy hamachi is my favorite as it is the freshest I've tasted since being in San Francisco. I also do enjoy their special rolls like the Pink Dragon and the Cherry Blossom. The chefs are so awesome and are always sure to say hello when I come in. Always a great experience when I come here and I highly recommend!!
author: Nina B.

description: My husband and I came here based on good yelp reviews and were not disappointed. The food was fantastic and reasonably priced. We had the ebi sunomono, shrimp and veggie tempura, simmered pork belly, and a dragon roll. Everything was fantastic and the service was perfection. Quiet, non-touristy area. We are definitely coming back!!
author: Robin R.

description:
Excellent sushi.  Some fresh from Japan.  Nice staff. Great owner/chef. Great soups and noodle dishes. 
I love this neighborhood place close to me.
author: Carole C.

description:
This is probably one of the best sushi rolls that I've had and I have been searching for sushi like this in the Bay Area for quite some time. I visited here with some friends on a busy Saturday night, without a reservation, but the hostess was willing to accommodate us like it was no trouble at all. We sat right up against the sushi bar and the chefs were friendly and gave out great recommendations. The wait service was also fantastic.

I had the Atlantic roll (quite honestly the most delicious) but the Spicy Mango roll was also incredible. I would recommend going straight for the specialty rolls part of the menu if you're going to dive right in, because this is a place that's doing them right. Plus, the portions are a great size, what you would expect. Lots of these trendy sushi places in the area seem to be cutting the size of their sushi smaller and smaller and you end up needing several rolls just to get a full dinner size, but here you get almost 10 pieces of sushi with each roll, so I was impressed. Absolutely worth checking out, but be smarter than me and make a reservation, because the place is tiny and we definitely just got lucky.
author: Veronica B.

description:
Delicious and fresh Japanese food. We ordered the preset sashimi plate that was $45 dollars with assorted sashimi, all tasted fatty and fresh. The oyster shooters were interesting, and there were strong Sake in it. I didn't like the cod appetizer, as it was not clear from the menu that it was going to be breaded and fried. I'd prefer the miso baked kind.

The service could be better.

The servers had a difficult time to put the plates on the sushi bar, where we were sitting. They came with plates from behind, and we had to lean to the sides for them to insert the plates in between us. That was awkward for them and for us. They could have just serve us the food from where the sushi chefs were; from the front instead. Also, the servers do not take the plates as we finish them, therefore, as they bring the new plates out, they don't have place to put them. They never refilled our green tea. 

Service could definitely be improved.
author: Angela C.

description:
I would've never expected to see Akira sitting on that particular section of Bush Street. They're busy too - a 45 minute wait on a week night for dinner.

The interior was dark, maybe I'd call it romantic, with candlelight and small tables meant for 2. There was an open sushi bar with friendly chefs slicing fresh, brightly colored fish into thick cuts of sashimi.

The menu was varied, which I thought was able to serve a group of people with different tastes. There is sashimi, sushi, rolls, don, but also small dishes like kama or grilled eggplant or something as simple as hiyayakko or oshitashi.

I had the hamachi kama, yellow tail collar, which was very fresh. Fish cheek is in general a very tender, moist section of the fish, but regardless, I thought Akira executed it well. It was served with the usual ponzu sauce and a wedge of lemon.
author: Cici T.

description:
Simply sushi.

Had an impromptu dinner here and I really enjoyed myself!  Given that everything was solid, I'd say it's a solid 4-star experience.  Something is missing for me to dish out the "5" and I can't say exactly what.  Just chalk it up to ambiance.  But I would totally come back! 

Food - 5 stars
Lots of vegetarian options and as long as you mention that to them, they will make sure nothing comes out that includes meat or fish sauces.  That being said, I thought everything was super fresh, flavorful, and delicious.  I went for
-Veggie Tempura
-Avocado Roll
-Pickled radish roll (I forgot what it's called but it was delish)
-Warm filtered sake (Did I mention there's a bar?  You could totally trade the sake for a cocktail)

Service - 4
Honestly, I think that service was pretty good given how new this place is.  Just small things I couldn't make a "5" - the guy spilled my sake and didn't offer a refill.  We had to ask for waters. My friend and I each ordered appetizers brought out mine out first, while he had to wait hella long for his. But seriously, none of these things impacted my experience too much.

Ambiance - 4+
It's a pretty cool spot, not a ton of space, but lots of choices.  You could come in alone and sit at that cool bar, head in with with a date (as there's not a lot of noise going on), or with a super small group.  Either way, it's a pleasant experience.  And BTW, we walked right in on a Thursday night!

***ONE LAST THING - This is smack dab on a busy street.  Parking around wasn't too bad on a Thursday night, but plan to circle a couple of times in this location*

All in all, sushi in a subdued ambiance, at a great value for your dollar!!
author: Angella S.

description:
I've had a few sushi places here in the city so far but by far this is my favorite. It's a small place so I'd suggest playing it safe with a reservation in advance if you can. 

We started with a few appetizers. The miso eggplant was fantastic. We had a hot egg pot too which was a big hit at our table. You gotta try the rolls though. They had a few good social ones and I also tried the Cherry Blossom roll. The fish was very fresh. Although not the cheapest option in town, the prices are affordable, especially for the quality you get. 

I'll be coming back for sure!
author: Grace A.

description:
We came around 5:30 on a Saturday

Bland food, I'd honestly rate it three stars if the prices weren't targeted for four star food.  My partner and I both disliked the super dry and bland rolls and canceled our plans to order more... got pizza on the way home  

This blandness was really noticeable on the Tempura Roll.  The tamago tasted like a battle of sugar, wine, and egg in my mouth -- it wasn't a fluid complimentary mixture.  The texture was also really hard, distinct, and off-putting. 

Atmosphere was kind of odd -- we didn't have a reservation so we sat at the bar.  Having a view of ingredient boxes wasn't a too appetizing sight.  This place could benefit from turning the lights down and picking one genre of music to stay on.  Was a mix of American pop and JPOP(?) that irregularly blended between the two.  Would probably be best to either pull a PABU and just play loud lounge music or just barely audible music.  I usually don't notice these kinds of things unless it detracts from the meal -- as you can see it did.

There were individuals waiting in line at the tight door area to be seated, which creates an awkward flow of traffic when trying to leave.

Overall, we'd give it another try... maybe... if we were starving for sushi and restricted to this area in rush hour.  It has generally good reviews and rating ratio;  could have been an off day.
author: Patarck S.

description: This place was amazing!! It is hands down my favorite sushi restaurant in  all of SF. We fell in love with the pink dragon roll! The flavor was incredible and the fish was so fresh!! Cannot wait to go back!
author: Rebecca L.

description:
Small and cozy sushi restaurant that's great for 1:1 dinners. Akira is tucked along a quiet block that's not so bustling with other restaurants and bars. The service was great and I loved how the staff said goodbye as we were leaving.

My friend and I decided to share some rolls. Everything on the menu was simple and pretty standard for a sushi restaurant. The portions were on the small side, but the food tasted great and satisfying.
author: Helen C.

description:
Service: 5*
Sushi: 3 * - 5 *
Atmosphere: 4*

The scallop uni ankimo quail egg spoons deserve a special mention. The flavour is incredible. I think I could eat those all day long. That would be an expensive day though. In any case, in my opinion that's a 5* dish.

Overall because of the service you will have an enjoyable experience here, if you are service-centric. Service always depends on who your server is, but ours was exceptional.

If you are food-centric, I found not all items on the menu are exceptional. Nothing is bad, but if you come here once and don't pick the right things you might be less impressed. There are a few dishes that really shine though.

There's a lot of sushi to explore in SF, but I wouldn't mind eating here again if the occasion presented itself! And it would be a way to have a few more of those ridiculously tasty ankimo spoons again sometime. Sometime soon.
author: Alex G.

description:
The Occasion:
My friend's birthday dinner.  The restaurant made a note of this, but did nothing to celebrate (not even place a candle on the desserts we ordered), let alone say happy birthday.

The Wait:
From the time of ordering, we waited 45 minutes for our drinks to arrive, and 80 minutes for our food to arrive.  We were a group of 5, with 2 orders of 7-course omakase, and 3 orders of individual entrees.  The individual entrees came out first, after 80 minutes, but the 3 of us were completely finished with the entrees before the 2nd course of the 7-course omakase was served.  Keep in mind the first course was 1 bite, so 2 of us awkwardly waited for our 3 friends to start and finish (after they waited until their food was cold, but commenced without us because they were starving and our food did not look like it was showing up anytime soon), after which the 2 of us awkwardly ate as the 3 of them stuck around waiting for us to start & finish dinner. 

The waiter also kept saying "1 minute, 1 minute!" in between each entree when in reality each was another 20 minutes.

The Service: 
What kind of $$$-rated restaurant 1. serves a piece of generic mochi ice cream as the omakase dessert, and 2. brings it out before your 7-piece sushi omakase entree ??? 


The Food:
The omakase came out of order, with no explanation from the waiter, and with 1 course from the 7-courses completely missing (they never brought it out).  

The 7-course omakase contained rather generic dishes for 'omakase' such as miso soup with mushrooms as 1 course, preserved jellyfish as a 2nd course (this is a common $0.99 / bag at Chinese markets for something 10X the size), and 2 pieces of mochi ice cream simply cut in half as a 3rd course.

The Bill:
Over $300, including us paying for dishes they entirely skipped from the 7-course "omakase" sets.

Advice to Management:
You have a lot of staff - they are clearly running around in chaos and panic.  However, anyone without restaurant operations management experience can tell you that the logistics of the operation is highly disorganized.  Staff are visibly not assigned particular roles, with 1 main waiter bringing out 95% of the dishes for the entire restaurant, and the remaining 5 waitresses running around, but always without anything in their hand, checking up on the girls who are checking up on the girls who are checking up on what the male waiter is bringing out.   In other words, you have 4-5 wait staff achieving nothing, all while the 1 waiter is receiving all the heat from a restaurant full of hungry staff.  As a result of being overwhelmed, the waiter was cancelling random parts of orders without issuing refunds on the bill so that he can catch up on being less behind.
author: Colette C.

description:
Came here for an early dinner on Saturday night with two friends. We were in the mood for sushi before going to see a movie at AMC Van Ness (which is less than a 10-minute walk away). We loved all the food we got - we all had various sushi rolls, plus tofu and edamame. And the wine was pretty good. Very reasonably priced. 

They do take reservations, and it seemed to be getting kind of crowded as we were leaving so it might be worth calling ahead.
author: Shoshana G.

description: Love this place!! Amazing staff, service and SUSHI of corse!! bomb calamari!! I'm a big foodie and I love coming here! Never disappoints!!
author: Ella G.

description: Very yummy sushi! I had the Dragon which was delicious, a garden salad with ginger dressing and a side of edemame. I would come back again.
author: Run.It.Off V.

description: This was some of the best, freshest sushi rolls I've had. The service was great. They fit us in between reservations because we didn't realize we needed one since we're from out of town. We would definitely go back. After we ordered a few rolls for the table, we decided to order more. The chef suggested the seared salmon belly, and it was absolutely our favorite; it had jalapeño and some type of sauce on top, which added a slight kick but wasn't too hot. I'd highly recommend Akira to anyone coming to the area. It's small, so I'd definitely make a reservation in the future. It's great to watch the chefs crafting the sushi.
author: Margot B.

description:
I found this place as a one year anniversary of our first date. We got sushi so I figured we'd do the same again. 

We decided to do two different things - he wanted to order a la carte and I ordered the omakase. They did have our favorite sparkling sake which was great. 

He got the salmon sashimi, seaweed salad, and dragon roll. All were good, but not the best. The omakase was good, but most of the dishes were just meh. Nothing was amazing, the fish was probably the best part of the meal, but still, that can't make up for all of it. Overall, had a good meal, but not the fan of everything. 

Protip: a la carte.
author: Nina Y.

description: We are here visiting San Francisco and decided to come here since it was down the street from our hotel. It was a nice venue, a cute whole in the wall place. One of the down falls is since it's a cold night out every time the door opened a cold breeze would travel our way =( be prepared and dress warm! Service was good and sushi was yummy! Bit pricey for me though, $34 for two rolls eeek
author: Angel M.

description:
One of the best sushi rolls I had . The rice is perfectly cooked and seasoned and the fish is fresh and tender. 

I ordered pink dragon roll which had tuna on the top instead of eel and it was so delicious .

Will definitely come back for their sashimi and rolls next time !!!!!
author: grace k.

description:
I was craving sushi and wanted to try something new, so I made a reservation for two at 5pm. 

The yelp reviews made it seem like we would have to wait to be seated, even with a reservation. We got lucky in that it rained the night we ate there, as there was no wait at all. I guess most people were ordering take out?

Their minimalist decor was very trendy and hip. We also appreciated the 80s hits playing softly in the background... good place to go on a date night. 

We immediately ordered hot sake, two orders of uni quail egg scallop ankimo, fried black cod belly and jalapeño poppers. Each appetizer was delicious in its own right, but the uni quail egg scallop ankimo was incredible. Being the first time that I tried quail egg, I was not expecting for it to be as delicious as it was. So much flavor and each ingredient complemented each other in perfection.

As main courses, we had the chirashi don bowl, the spider roll and the Akira cucumber roll. The chirashi bowl was a generous portion and the fish was fresh. The Akira cucumber roll had a beautiful presentation and was a tasty option to have, should you not want to worry about extra carbs (no rice). The spider roll was solid as well.

We finished it up with two grilled ice cream desserts. The black sesame ice cream inside of the dessert was another pleasant surprise. Delicious. We weren't too impressed with the foamy, outer part of the dessert.

Lastly, the service was impeccable. Attentive but not overbearing or pressuring. Nice option for a night out.
author: Aundrea j.

description:
Literally the best sushi I have ever had in my life! The blue fin tuna nigiri showed me what raw fish should taste like. I thought the sushi I had been eating was good but nahh.

They even had delicious fried chicken for my not-sushi liking boyfriend!

The staff was very friendly and the service was  super fast. The red bean mochi dessert was delicious and filling, the perfect way to end the meal.
 


I am definitely coming back every time I'm in the city!
author: Karly M.

description: Wow! The best sushi we had in SF. Prices are completely correct. Quality of fish is outstanding. Service is impecable. Restaurant is clean. I'd give this place 10 stars.
author: Raley S.

description:
First timer.. most likely the last time too. Not a place to go to when you're hungry. Expensive food, small portions. You pay for the quality. 

I thought this place would be a hole in the wall because of the 4 star average from 500+ people but I didn't find anything special. Yes, the staff was respectful and nice; our server was patiently waiting for us to decide our order (we took a decent amount of time and she came to us multiple times.) 

Note: If you're a server, maybe wait for the customers to have their menus closed before asking for their order.  
 
We went around dinner time and didn't have a lot of their food items available which was disappointing because they didn't have an extensive menu to look through in the first place. It's a small place but it wasn't at all crowded. Zero wait. So they shouldn't' even 86ed anything. 

Food: pretty good. Sad that they didn't have many choices. Hence, the long overview of what to order. Very fresh fish. My favorite dish was the vegetable tempura -- it was light, flaky, and not overly doused with breading or oil.  For 2 tempura udons, (chicken and beef were neither available) and 2 sushi rolls; the order came to ~$60. *shrug*
author: Janine P.

description: Snuck in here with my friend Mona right before they closed for lunch. The staff was really nice. It was the Friday before the holidays and we got the Sushi combination lunch special. It came with 6 pieces of nigiri: tuna, yellowtail, salmon, albacore tuna, 2 pieces of chef's choice and one California roll or one spicy tuna roll served with miso soup. All of that for $17.50 is a good deal, but you'd have to come Mon-Fri between 11:30am-2:30pm. Since I'm normally at work during these hours, I'll have to come try their dinner.
author: Christine C.

description:
The meal I had here was delicious! I will definitely return. 

A friend wanted to try so we went on a Thursday night around 830 and were seated at the bar without reservations. 

We each got the omakase and it did not disappoint. The miso black cod was flavorful and the skin was the perfect amount of crisp. The nigiri was absolutely amazing. 

The head chef Minh was a delight and we loved sitting at the bar.
author: Tiffany S.

description: I went here with 3 others and we ordered 8 rolls (mostly from the special rolls menu) total - I forget what they were called, but they were generally all quite delicious and reasonably priced. Akira's a casual and welcoming place with good service.
author: Josh L.

description:
One of the best Japanese restaurants I've been to. Great service, great ambience for a date or a dinner with friends, and definitely great food. Some dishes are fairly expensive but that's pretty standard for SF. Would say that each dish lived up to its price.

Definitely recommend the Otoro Sashimi/Nigiri cut -- probably the best sashimi I've had since I left Japan. Highly recommend overall.
author: Weber W.

description: Wonderful sushi restaurant near Japan Town but not in Japan Town.  Sushi is fresh, place is clean.  Service is Good!  Rice tea is very good.  Owners are super nice.
author: Robert M.

description: Good sushi, but a bit pricey with smaller portions. I came with my boyfriend on a Friday night with no reservation, and we were seated immediately which was nice. The fish was really fresh, and service was great, but I must admit I left the place still hungry. We ordered a couple of rolls, some nigiri, and the hamachi kama.
author: Cynthia M.

description:
Had high expectations going in, given my fellow Yelper's review. However, before we even got seated, the hostess had divided a 3 table set (from prior party) into 3 separate table, nearly making my party of 4 wait (which includes two kids). I asked--how come you separate and seat 2 other parties of two persons after us, when you can seat us (the first party was before us, so it made sense..but it could be 2 and our 4). Luckily, they had some sensibilities and rectified the solution.

We ordered the grilled squid which was excellent. Tempura udon was decent--the usual. What killed it was the rice--yes.  I think they may somehow be low on the rice, because the ootoro nigir had such piddling rice base to rest on. We also ordered the chirashi which had the worst sushi rice I have ever had--it was dry, clumpy, and lack the flavor or rice...it tasted like broken rice. I am tempted to give 2 stars but the grille squid and the service itself by the staff (other than the hostess) was good.

Rolls are also very tiny, but the kids like the dragon roll (all cooked ingredients..i.e. unagi and crab).
author: Sonny W.

description: Made a ressie on Resy for two on a Tuesday night.  We came in with the 7:00 rush. It took about ten minutes for someone to take our drink order and then almost one bottle of wine (40 minutes) later, we received our first appetizer and a glass of water.  We ordered omakase, but the first two offerings were not explained to us.  Played a guessing game of: what squishy thing is this in my mouth? At that point we complained - both about the timing and the service.  We were told the staff was new.  However, our table neighbors turned over twice before we got to dessert and once we complained our dishes came rushing out before we could barely taste the last.  So was the cooking staff new too? For ya'll who dig omakase, you know the timing and presentation are the whole reason you're willing to trust the chef's choices! We were pretty disappointed. Of the offerings, the best was the sashimi and the miso cod.  Everything else was "meh".  The price of 65$ is reasonable, but we weren't wow'ed by our mystery dishes. We were comp'ed the wine for our troubles.
author: T. W.

description:
We got the omakase and also a few additional items because, we're just big eaters! The spoonful of happiness is delicious with uni, ankimo and oyster. The omakase was good, but we weren't satisfied with the nigiris. The flavors weren't there, the sushi rice wasn't flavored, the fish wasn't seasoned. I get that this is good value for $65 for omakase in the city, but there are definitely better sushi restaurants out there for nigiri if that's what you're looking for. We got a bottle of wine for 3 people and ended up about $120 a person with additional nigiris and the spoonful of happiness special. I think at that price, daigo and koo are much better. 

This is a quick fast sushi joint that are probably better for with rolls and kaiseki style offerings.
author: Joanna S.

description:
The best part of our meal here probably was the friendly service. I loved that our waitress brought out a warm towel for our hands when we sat down but waited to bring out the other towels when the rest of our party arrived. 

Best thing we had were the hamachi carpaccio appetizer special (with avocado slices and a tasty cucumber and mango slaw) and the hamachi kama. The rolls we ordered were fine, but not spectacular and definitely smaller in size.  We enjoyed our dinner with cold house sake, which was smooth and delicious.

For dessert we tried the black sesame ice cream, but I found the black sesame flavor slightly lacking. Overall great service and ok food.
author: Swan L.

description: We stumbled upon this on our walk to Polk street for dinner and decided to go in. We were unsure as we've tried so many sushi places in SF and they are always a huge hit or miss. This was a huge hit!!! Great service and great quality sushi. Enjoyable ambience - it was packed by 6:00pm so we're glad we walked in so early by accident. Would definitely come here again. Loved their snow crab roles and they had the best hot sake
author: Felicia C.

description:
Came here on a Saturday night to take a table for four around 930pm. Was glad that we could be accommodated, as I called earlier that evening to be told it was fully booked. 
The place itself is not somewhere you would stumble upon, so thank god for Yelp. It's a very nicely decorated dining area, and there was a nice atmosphere. 
I have to say this is the best sushi I've had in SF. And possibly ever. Everything we ordered was top notch and it's really good value. The bill for 4 including beers was only $160, and we had lots of dishes. 
The stand out items are the grilled asparagus on the appetizer menu, and the pink dragon rolls on the special rolls menu. Also tried the tuna sashimi among others. 
The reason for not giving 5 stars is the service was a little slow and not overly enthusiastic, and there is a very limited wine menu. 
Otherwise this place cannot be faulted.
author: Derek M.

description: I cannot even begin to describe how bomb this place is. I will have dreams about this place for quite some time. If in season and they are offering the special, get the uni spoon. It's Uni, quail egg, monk fish liver, ponzu and truffle oil. I ate the whole thing by myself and I could have had 3 orders of it. Best thing you've ever put in your mouth. I also had the salmon belly roll which was just as exquisite.
author: Sarah M.

description:
Love it! It's our favorite spot, especially for lunch (the salmon teriyaki is amazing). Sweetest waiter and owner!! 
And the black sesame ice cream is the best.
author: Lina L.

description:
Akira was absolutely amazing and is definitely now my favorite sushi spot in SF. For 2 people, we ordered (2) Chirashi Dons, (2) miso soups, (1) hiyayakko, (1) akira roll, (1) atlantic roll, (2) mochi ice creams, and a bottle of sake (yuzu ozeki hana). 

Everything tasted great - the fish was extremely fresh and very well prepared - but if I had to pick a favorite, it would have to be the atlantic roll. The service was also outstanding - our waitress was very sweet and attentive. Overall, 10/10 would recommend.
author: Katherine N.

description:
I had a yummy dinner at Akira on Friday. I called the day before to make a reservation for 2 at 8pm. When I first arrived, I was seated at the table closest to the door and when another party left, I asked to be moved since it was too cold to sit where the door opens and closes. Our server was friendly and helpful.

We got 3 rolls - Pink Dragon, Spicy Mango, and Seared Salmon Belly (on specials menu). We both agreed that the Pink Dragon (with shrimp tempura) was the best and the Spicy Mango was not as good as the other two. We also ordered Sake (salmon) nigiri, which was not as buttery as I like my salmon. In addition, we had the Miso Gindara; again it was good but I've had better black cod at other Japanese restaurants. We also shared a bottle of Dassai Nigori sake. 

The portion sizes were small. Somehow the rolls seemed tiny and the nigiri sushi was compact and the cod was mini-sized as well. For the same price point, you can get a lot more in terms of quality, quantity, creativity, and value at Elephant Sushi. Akira is good; there's just better out there.
author: Yi Z.

description: Our favorite local sushi spot in SF! The perfect date night atmosphere with great quality and at a reasonable price too. We are always very happy with our meals here and will continue to be regulars while we live in the area :)
author: Holly S.

description:
Amazing service. Fresh fish. Awesome prices. Will definitely be coming back. 

Came in without reservations with my friend at 7:45 and was quickly seated at a table that was supposed to be reserved for an 8:30 party. They felt bad about having potentially rushed us (service was awesome, no rush was necessary) that they gave us two [delicious] sesame ice cream desserts for us. Now THAAAT is amazing service. 

Food was delicious--got the chirashi which had very fresh and flavorful fish. My friend got the roll with shiso, natto roll, and tempura roll. All great flavors and the prices are really reasonable especially in SF. 

Highly recommend checking this spot out.
author: George M.

description:
I haven't found too many decent sushi places in SF, so Akira is definitely a welcomed addition to the Japanese restaurant lineup in the city. 

The interior has a stylish, modern look. I came on valentine's day and the table set up was private and intimate. 

Everything tasted fresh with distinct, clean flavors. There were so many delicious sounding appetizers that I wanted to try them all! Some of my favorite dishes were the raw oysters, the dragon roll, and the salmon belly. Make sire to order some items off of the special's menu to try some sashimi from Japan. 

I was very impressed by the food and the service. Akira will be my new go to place for quality, authentic sushi.
author: Sean W.

description:
Amazing fish! Very high quality. One of the best Sushi we had. I loved everything I tasted - Hawaiian poke (very spicy - beware), nigiris, pink dragon, dragon, hand rolls, salmon avocado, and a few others I can't remember. It it was all superb!!!

Service was nice but slow. This is a place for when you want to sit down for a while and chat over great food.
author: Mel G.

description:
Eh it's okay.  Best part was probably the super nice staff (although I'm not a fan of the waitress who when we tried to order a particular roll, told us we don't want that we should order this one one instead).  

This place is also super loud.  For us, it was like we were at a bar, so not the best place if you want to have any type of dinner conversation.

In terms of food, we got the sashimi platter, the tempura udon, anago tempura, and some roll that the waitress insisted we get.  The tempera was okay, but the shell wasn't that crispy, and the dipping sauce could have been saltier.  Overall the food is decent, not that great, and really not worth the wait out the door.  Save your time and money.
author: Tiffany C.

description:
Came here on Valentine's Day with my boo and we didn't know we needed reservations! But they were so nice and found a table for us. 
We ordered the tori karage and miso soup as appetizers. Tasty, but i wish the karage came with a dip and not just lemon.
We ordered sake and unagi nigiri. The unagi was on point! I love eel. My boyfriend usually doesn't order eel but he loved it as well! We also ordered two rolls the cherry blossom and the other I don't recall the name. It was probably because it was on a side menu but it was something salmon belly? Anyways they were both really good & fresh.
For dessert we ordered the sesame ice cream. Super savory!
We will return again. Great service and great food!
author: Marilee A.

description:
New joint that I recently brought my girlfriend to because she loves Japanese food and we heard great things about this place. I think the service was great, our server was nice, spontaneous, and fun. The food was pretty good for the most part. We ordered the Omakase which was only $65 per person for 7 courses + Hokkaido uni quail egg with scallop and hamachi carpaccio with truffle oil, fruit sake, and plum wine. 

The appetizers on the 7 course menu i could've done without, they weren't great but doesn't add anything to the dish. I also didn't like the red miso soup that much. Apart from those 2, I liked everything else I had. The only gripe I have with this place is the 2 pieces of bones found in my girlfriends salmon nigiri. Not very pleasant. 

Other than that, this place is great, i'd come back!
author: Kevin W.

description:
It's okay! o k with a ay ;)

I want to love the food, but there is so much better in SF! They are so so sweet and welcoming. 

Ambience is cute and minimal.. duh!

But again, food is meh!
author: Kaitlyn B.

description: The best I've had!  Love the atmosphere, good beer, and the sushi!  So glad I stopped in!
author: Patti P.

description: Came here on a Wednesday night. Ambience is quite nice - somewhat dark and probably a good place to go on a date or with a couple of friends. I ordered a black spider roll ($12) and the uni quail egg scallop ankimo (3 for $15). The mix of flavors on the ankimo was incredible as its presentation (it's really pretty). Service was quality and I'll definitely be back for more!
author: Miguel F.

description:
Very very ordinary / average Japanese restaurant. With such high rating on Yelp , I went in on a Valentine day with high expectation. 
No wait at all and the restaurant are pretty empty . 

Got seated with the staff are friendly . 
The menu selection wasn't big , there is a law of the lunch menu which can't be applicable for dinner. But on the Don and noodles section it did not specify it is for Lunch only . So I wanted to order the Unagi Don but the waiter said that Don/ noodles place are for lunch only . 

Big bummer ,  if Don and noodles are for lunch only then what else can we order besides nigiri , sashimi and appetizer . There is a $65 omakase included nigiri , dessert and appetizer but does not seems worth it so I didn't get that. 

So I asked the waiter if I can get the chirashi don ($19) the most expensive Don on the menu and he said yes. Okay ... so .... he just said the Don are only for lunch but I can only order chirashi for tonight .... okay....  another skeptical part is , I asked what about the udon he said he need to ask the chief . So we ended up with a chirashi , a Kobe dragon and rainbow roll . Plus two pieces of Hokkaido scallops nigiri . 

Overall , the portion are really small , especially the chirashi .... very disappointing. The fishes are not fresh .... but i enjoyed the Kobe dragon roll ! 

The Hokkaido scallop priced at $8 for two , don't order that .... it just taste super ordinary like the one you can buy on the street anywhere .

A side note is ,Tea is $2 each , they did not tell me when I order them . 
I will probably not come back again , because of the quality is not fresh and it is just not worth a visit .tsubasa sushi are way better , on the same district .
author: Priscilla F.

description:
Maybe it's just because I don't have a sophisticated enough palate, but I oftentimes have a hard time noticing a big difference in quality and flavor from sushi restaurant to sushi restaurant. This was definitely not the case at Anita, though. It was here, for the first time, that I actually think I was able to understand what people mean when they say they had great sushi. 

We went with the omakase, split between two people, as well as the spicy tuna and roasted duck.

Roasted Duck: 4/5

Mad juicy and flavorful. Duck was more medium to medium well, but certainly not overcooked. It was well salted and delicious with a squeeze of lemon on top. The one thing I didn't love about it was the chewy fat that came on top. It had a nice caramelized too, but it wasn't the kind of melt-in-your-mouth fat like pork belly that I don't mind eating -- more rubbery and tough.

Spicy Tuna: 4/5

Spicy tuna rolls, more often than not, are just spicy mayo rolls with a little bit of tuna mixed in. This was not the case here. It was very tuna forward -- it had a good blend of fat in it with some heat and a nice soft texture. The rice was well seasoned, too -- a balanced mix of vinegar and sugar.

Omakase: 4/5

Can't pretend that I remember everything we were served, but there were a few standout dishes. The grilled fish was probably my favorite. It had a very light coating of marinade -- a sweet and salty, almost teriyaki-like glaze which infused it with flavor but didn't overwhelm. The fish was unbelievably tender and flakey, and the grilled skin at the bottom was a concentration of crispy, umami goodness. Also loved the nigiri we were served -- each fish had its own distinct, subtle but delicious flavor. I especially liked the white fish which was just barely seared on top -- velvety, buttery and delicious. The dessert was very good, too -- a small piece of green tea cheesecake that was small, dense, and rich. Not too sweet with a nice firm set and green tea flavor.

The atmosphere was modern and relaxing, from the limited number of tables to the soft lighting and black and mahogany accents. One thing I would change would be the music, which consisted of late 2000s and contemporary pop -- to be honest, I liked the relaxing, traditional music playing in the bathrooms! 

While some plates were better than others, the menu was creative, high-quality and diverse, and that, plus the gentle ambience, made for a fun night out. I'd recommend it to anyone near the area.
author: Emily M.

description: My roommates brought me here for a belated birthday dinner and we had a great time! We all did the $65 omakase and ordered a bottle of shochu. The staff was really friendly and helpful when we had questions. The food was good, but not the best I've had in the city around that price. Our omakase included pickled veggies and soups along with the sushi.  Everything was pretty good, but I think our group consensus was the green tea cheesecake was the best dish of the night. One thing I didn't like was that our waitress would lean in towards my roommates (2 guys) to describe the dishes, but she spoke in a whisper so I basically had no idea what I was eating and she never bothered to repeat it for me.
author: Estelle C.

description: I love this place. For $65 Omakase, the quality is so good. It's even better than some $85 ones at other restaurants. The environment is friendly. No need to dress up, but still get quality food. The space is very small tho.
author: Momo W.

description:
If you're looking for a sushi joint worth your money, Akira is the spot! I'm pretty picky when it comes to eating sushi because of how "fishy" fish would taste, and salmon is pretty much the only fish I eat raw. So I was really impressed with how fresh the fish tasted here! The seared salmon belly was literally bomb dot com. It was really cool to see the sushi chef using a blow torch to sear the salmon. I was really amazed. Then it was topped with jalapeño to give it a spicy kick. I also got the pink dragon & spicy mango which was two flavorful rolls., and again I was blown away of how yummy the fish was.

Also, I overheard a women telling the waiter and sushi chef how much she loved the melon that was served there. The sushi chef thanked her for the comment and even gave her a whole melon to take home! I thought that was such a nice gesture from the sushi chef. He definitely cares about his customers and their satisfaction.

Overall, my experience at Akira was great & was blown away by the flavorful taste (:
author: Tina C.

description: Came here for date night. Staff was attentive and nice. We ordered 4 rolls, and they were good. Only downside was that the raw fish on top was sliced a bit too thin imo.
author: Thalia H.

description: The quality of the fish is fresh and very good. Portions were decent. The prices reasonable for this part of town. Nice cozy environment and friendly service.
author: Andrew P.

description: What a fantastic restaurant! The food was amazing and the service was great. Each dish was really good and crafted with care. The executive chef/owner accommodated me with no problem when I asked for an nigiri omakase even though it wasn't on the menu, and it was hands down one of the best I have had in SF. Another reason we initially choose to go to Akira was the hot dish menu, as my wife is pregnant. The dishes on that menu were fantastic as well. We will absolutely be back!
author: Adam N.

description: Weekday lunch reviews by other Yelpers proved to be extremely useful. Akira is the perfect Japantown spot to eat some authentic sushi/sashimi for lunch. They have a number of lunch and daily specials that make Akira a worthy lunch selection that won't break the bank. What you need to order ASAP is the hamachi carpaccio (simply wow). The lunch bento box is also a nice (under $20) deal, which we ordered and shared, but I would probably order two items off the menu next time to replace the bento box im addition to the hamachi carpaccio. I would even consider just 2 hamachi carpaccios for lunch. It seems that dinner is somewhat pricier so definitely try out lunch first. They do have some very unique chef selections that make the dinner seem worth the price. Our server was excellent and very attentive and the small size makes it feel intimate yet informal. I would highly recommend Akira to anyone looking for an authentic Japanese meal.
author: Jesus Z.

description: Delicious food. The grilled asparagus were AMAZING! We ordered the tempera appetizer and mixed salad. Both were decent.  I didn't really care for the dressing on the salad, but my daughter loved it.  The tempera was good, although the shrimp tempura was slightly cool.  We had California rolls, a Philly roll, and a spicy crunch roll.  All delicious.  We finished off the meal with black sesame ice cream which was very good.  We got there about 5:30, and had no wait.
author: Jen S.

description:
sooooo nobody saw me take that spill in the busy intersection right? y'all didn't see that shhh right? but you did hear my mixtape not skip a beat on the lucy pearl during the tizzumble right?

premeal hot towel was more relevant than they thought bc i was literally wiping the road off my hands gzus.

rltk tho wgaf what the ratings are this place is named after one of the best anime movies* ever = of course i went.

(^_^) Kamo Shioyaki (Duck) $12 (http://bit.ly/2hn7col)
warm & savory #twss
don't sauce / garnish it's best straight

(^_^) Iced Tea $2 (http://bit.ly/2gPyp1B)
roasted rice green tea
bottomless

(-_^) Amaebi $8 (http://bit.ly/2ht5rbR)
heads n tails (http://bit.ly/2gBeBBI)

(-_^) Wasabi Squid $10 (http://bit.ly/2gq5EaX)
it stings the nostrils
could use more wasabi distribution

(-_-) Anago $7 (http://bit.ly/2hjKHA0)
hmm

(-_-) Unicorn (Leather Jacket) $20 (http://bit.ly/2hC1PjM)
forgettable tastewise & texturewise
sounded cool but ::shrug::

service was attentive af, maybe bc place is way new?

i wouldn't take a date here bc basicish menu but it's classy in its own ways. loveee the plates imported from japan.

oh oh and the BATHROOM almost deserves an extra star on its own it's like you stepped into a yoga studio no jk see it for yourself some namaste shhh for real.

arigato!

*their website says the name refers to "three suns" but real heads know what's up about red capes and meatloaf arms.
author: Dan B.

description: My favorite neighborhood sushi spot in SF. The owner and his team are fantastic. And the sushi is even better. Highly recommend the rolls. The fish is incredibly fresh. The veggie rolls are the best I've ever had. Pro tip: try the Vegi Tempura roll. So good.
author: Eric O.

description: The food is great!!!! We two girls wolfed a bunch of stuff on a Friday night when we were absolutely starving. We went back after two weeks and the waitor remembers us. Anyway, I would recommend making reservation beforehand since this place does get very popular.
author: Ruby H.

description: We ordered the omakaze dinner menu. While the first course was tantalizing, the rest of the dinner was a major disappointment. Salt dominated the two soup courses. The sashimi was fresh, and it left me begging for more. However, the 7 pieces of nigiri that came later could lacked flavor.
author: Calforever C.

description:
My go-to sushi restaurant. 
= Service is great - they always remember me
= Sushi chefs are very sweet and talkative! If you are sitting at the counter make sure to talk with them! 
= Sushi is a little pricey but it is great quality
author: Jean C.

description:
High quality fish, great service, good price!

Last night was my first time eating at Akira and I will definitely be back. There's of us say at the corner of the bar which I would definitely recommend - so much skill goes into preparing sushi and omakase! Highly recommend the spicy mango roll. Even though I'm not a huge spicy food fan, the sweet mango balanced out the spicy sauce perfectly. When we got up to leave, the cooks all looked up and wished us a good night. Such a little thing, but shows you that they appreciate their customers! Only negative in my mind is that there were two loud tables and the restaurant ended up getting quite noisy.
author: Emily F.

description: We love that food and the chef was so nice we going back drinks are so good is a small place but really nice for a date or romantic dinner
author: Glenda T.

description: Stopped by for dinner late ish on Sat. Glad they take online reservations! The restaurant was really intimate, nicely lit and minimalist. There was a bachelorette party up front which was a bit strange. Service was great, food was fresh and they kept the hot sake flowing :) We ended our meal with green tea mochi and it definitely hit the spot. We shared 5 dishes between the 2 of us and I was comfortably satiated. Looking forward to coming again - seems like a really nice neighborhood / local spot and try the omakase next time.
author: Yin H.

description: Amazing addition to the neighborhood. Love love love it. Omakasi was superb. Let the chef treat you.
author: James L.

description: One of the main reasons I miss working in SF is because I cannot eat at Akira for lunch easily. When I was working in Pacific Heights, I came to Akira at least twice a week for lunch because they were a couple doors down, have great service, and have a wonderful menu. The head sushi chef, is such a nice person, and his staff is very competent. I have had many things on the menu, and everything tastes wonderful: the lunch Shokado bento and sesame ice cream are very special. I came on opening night, and came back opening day because it was that good, and I knew that when the word got out, this place would be packing with people.
author: Jacqueline L.

description:
The restaurant is very nicely decorated. It has a cozy atmosphere. The lighting is good. The food was great ! At first i didnt know what to get. Then the sushi chef referred the bento box. It was a great meal. Comes with alot of food. I got the bento box. Shokado bendo, comes with miso soup, pickles and rice. The service was great. They were very attentive. Refilled my water often, got me everything i asked for and was very friendly.  

Overall this is my new go to japenese restaurant!!!
author: Jack J.

description: Omakase for $65 and it's great? Yes. Friendly neighborhood spot with great nigiri , small rice, very fresh fish and zero attitude.
author: marc p.

description: The best sushi I've had in years, and I go to Japan regularly. The owner and head chef, Minh, learned from a master in Sapporo. His passion for the food and the space is evident from the bar details, to the beautiful cuts of sashimi, to his jubilant energy.
author: Erika S.

description:
Akira served overpriced food that was very mediocre. The karaage was tasteless and not that crunchy. The fish wasn't the best quality, so their sushi rolls came out pretty bland as well. I came here on my way to the airport and ended up eating at SFO again because I was so unsatisfied. 

The venue itself is very clean and simple, though. The service was very good. Our host/waiter was informative, respectful, and accommodating. I wouldn't come back here, though, considering the other options around the area.
author: Karissa I.

description: Everything we had was awesome! Got the Cherry Blossom and the Pink Dragon roll, which were fresh and came out very quickly. Service was friendly. Would definitely come here again.
author: Chris J.

description:
We just had dinner and it was a Wonderful experience. From the Excellent Service to the Delicious Food! 

We were very happy with every aspect of the meal. My hubby enjoyed the chefs special and it was made in a thoughtful manner with fantastic cuts of fish. We will be back!!!
author: Rebecky L.

description: Great local sushi place.  Friendly staff that was very accommodating.  The sushi was awesome!
author: Mike S.

description: Absolutely my favorite sushi restaurant in SF. The fish is always fresh and the staff is attentive and wonderful. We always choose Akira when we want sushi
author: Casey F.

description: Super great experience with friends. Great nigiri, fresh cod, nice vibes. Most importantly, they take reservations and it's quiet for conversations compared with other sushi places in SF.
author: Grace T.

description: Yum. Gotta try the hamachi carpaccio with truffle oil. All fish are fresh. Chefs are very knowledgeable. There are not many seats so reservations are a must. But these chefs really make the food taste great. They're friendly and they make it so well. Great combinations of fish veggies and flavors.
author: Jesse J.

description: This place was really good. Fish was fresh, customer service was great and we got our food relatively fast. Will be returning.
author: Chris S.

description: I'm from Pennsylvania and I love sushi. This place doesn't mess around. As a traveling nurse I hit up different cities and being a foodie is a new hobby. I would definitely suggest this place if you want great food and friendly service!
author: Ashley J.

description: I'm not a fan of sushi, but this place I will probably visit again. Nice arrangements and overall design of a place with a moderate calm ambience. But you're not going to restaurants to check out the design. You're going to eat. As I said i'm not a fan, though this place was chosen by my local friend in Nay Area. He told me I will love it, and I have to admit. I love it!
author: Nade T.

description:
