We made reservations here on a Saturday evening, and thank god we did because the restaurant was pretty tiny. It was about 7 pm and the lighting inside was so dark we could barely see our menus! Guess that's something they're going for though. 

Service was great, I loved the warm hand towels they gave us before the meal. 

Our party of three started off with three rolls to share, and edamame, and we were pretty hungry. The rolls themselves were on the smaller side, but the fish was very fresh and the rolls were well-prepared. We ate them so fast, we had to order another roll because we were still hungry. 

We finished the meal by ordering the mochi trio, which was just a fun little taste of ice cream, but nothing very special. 

Overall, I enjoyed my experience and the service was excellent, but I would've appreciated some larger rolls. The total for a party of three came out to be about 65$, and for the broke students that we are, probably can't go there again anytime soon.
author: Jessica M.

description: Good quality fish and decent service but 4 stars because their service was incredibly slow and they charged us for the edamame despite the fact they told us it was on the house! Their rolls are small so order more than you normally would.
author: Reiko P.

description:
Frankly can't believe that this restaurant has 4.5 star.
Food was just okay but the service and the prep time take a long time. (30 min or more).
author: Sean L.

description:
I am totally confused by the 4.5 star rating, and also by the reviewers who said the fish was super fresh. Maybe I went on an off day, but the fish was definitely not fresh (aside from the salmon, which was fine). I absolutely love raw fish (it's one of my favorite things to eat), and I am always interested in trying new sushi places, but this one really let me down.

The redeeming factor was the waiter, who was really friendly and patient, and when I was weary of the sketchy uni (it looked, smelled and tasted really off), he apologized and took it off the bill. An extra star (and tip) for that.

There are literally dozens of better sushi places in SF than this one.
author: Jen K.

description:
Lovely neighborhood restaurant. Swung by for a quick lunch in a rush and these guys put me at the top priority for the kithen and got me an incredible bento box in seconds.

The chef is incredibly nice and proud. They do countryside Japanese cuisine and serve fish with their bento boxes.  WAY better than what you typically get in Japantown.
author: Daniel D.

description:
We stopped in on our way home for an early dinner around 5:30pm. We were sat immediately and the service was awesome. We really enjoyed the flavor of the miso soup and cucumber seaweed salad. I ordered the wallu nigiri and hamachi belly sashimi. The wallu was bland for my taste but the hamachi belly was ok. It was tender, however, most sushi restaurants I've been to put a little sauce to enhance the flavor of the fish or to put their twist on it. Everything that came out had spicy mayo, which isn't original and certainly not my favorite. My friend ordered the pink dragon roll which was really good and the special roll they had for the day. It was just ok. For the price we paid for the food and it being mediocre, I don't think I will be back. 

I'm rating two stars for the service. Although parts of the meal was good, the focus was sushi, and it wasn't satisfying for either of us.
author: Alison P.

description:
I went there yesterday for dinner.
Service are awesome, the quality of fish is nice.
Green tea mochi ice surprised me. 
Mochi part is soft and the aroma of green tea ice cream spill in my mouth like heaven.
I will definitely go again.
author: Chia C.

description:
Great specials, amazing sushi. Favorite neighborhood sushi spot. 
Ankimo is really great, as is the sashimi and all the rolls are great. We haven't gotten anything we didn't like. Also the sushi chefs are really friendly. It's great to sit at the sushi bar and order through them.
author: Stephanie S.

description:
Found this restaurant a month ago and have had to come back twice since. They have amazing food and great service. My personal favorites are the avocado roll and the garden salad(the ginger miso dressing is the BEST). 
The staff is always very friendly. Specifically, the chef Minh is very welcoming and always makes a point to talk to me when I stop by. 
I think it's easy to miss but so worth stopping by.
author: Maggie G.

description: We came here around 9 pm for dinner. It was crowded but were seated immediately. Decided to have the omakase because we didn't want any rolls. It's served kaiseki style and was fantastic.  Best deal I've ever had for omakase. Fish was fresh and delicious. With so many great choices for sushi, I almost never repeat but I will absolutely be coming back.
author: Lien D.

description: The Miso soup udon here is amazing. I don't usually like miso soup because it tends to be salty. Here it's so light and refreshing. The ingredients are very fresh. I'm just amazed by the menu options. It has something for everyone from seafood lovers, vegetarian only, or meat lovers. Great place for a date and group lunch and dinner. My favorites the pumpkin rolls, dragon, and caterpillar. The owner Judy and Minh are very friendly, humble, and detail oriented, so you will like it.
author: Soknay L.

description: I hardly ever write reviews, but if I could only write one it would be for Akira.  It is my favorite restaurant in San Francisco because the food is incredible and the service is even better.  Chef Minh and his wife Judy are the kindest people I've met in this City. The sushi, sashimi and nigiri are some of the best I've had.  I would definitely recommend Akira to anyone who wants to enjoy an incredible dinner with amazing service.  I feel like family when I go in, and it's more than worth the price.  Simply perfect.
author: Meredyth M.

description: Everything was delicious. Dishes were simple and fresh. One suggestion: more uni on the Uni Spoon. It's a signature item - don't skimp on the main attraction.
author: Mr A.

description: Simply amazing! Best sushi in SF by far, would visit every night if I could.  We went here for my birthday and we all had the most amazing meal.  Very fresh fish and love the decor.  This place gets packed on weekends but definitely worth coming!!  Go now ;)
author: Tina T.

description: I almost hate to write this review, it is already tough to get in. This sushi restaurant on Bush is amazing. The owners are wonderful and provide amazing service. Food is fab! I have only had nigiri but soooo good and fresh. It is my new local go to for sushi. I went twice in one week and will be back this week as well to try more. Love the ambiance and experience as well. Fun place!
author: Susan F.

description: Fantastic local sushi! You will feel at home hear. Incredibly fresh and a wide variety flown in from Japan, looking up the special board as a must. Hamachi Kama the best in San Francisco! Grilled squid, a must.hon-maguro,melts in you mouth, have to check the board for that! Busy spot get there early. Service is with a smile!
author: Brad S.

description: I am really picky with my sushi, but this place was really delicious. I am pretty boring with what I order so I had nigiri blue fin tune, salmon and topiko and it was really good! the place was a small quaint cute place and felt really nice and the service itself was really great. it wasn't the best sushi I've ever had but it was definitely in my top favs!
author: Anabella R.

description: Great place to eat. Service was awesome and the chefs were super nice and great to talk to.
author: Marc B.

description:
Delicious and super fresh. One of the best sushi dinners I've had in SF.

Owner/chef is warm and welcoming, and the rest of the service was great too. So glad to have them in the neighborhood.
author: D C.

description: This is a restaurant with amazing quality and variety! Try the black cod, the cheek of yellowtail, and many other authentic dishes. Great service!!
author: David F.

description: One of my favorite sushi places in the city! I've been many times and never been disappointed. The staff is really friendly and the sushi is the freshest I've ever had. I LOVE the mango roll (can't remember the exact name). Highly recommend going and making a reservation since it's a small spot.
author: Kristen W.

description:
This place is awesome! Super fresh tasty fish and great flavors, the chefs really know what they're doing. Couldn't get enough of the Akira cucumber roll!

Great service as well, our waiter was super friendly and chill. Will definitely be back to try the lunch specials.
author: Lauren W.

description:
Don't think about passing this delightful place by. 
My husband and I love eating at different places for sushi and other foods and had a wonderful time here. 
The staff was so friendly and pleasant throughout our meal. We decided to sit up at the bar where the chef was delightful to carry on conversations. They were genuine and helpful to us. 
The food was pretty good to match the service. We were not disappointed with the price at the end of our meal too!
author: Emily F.

description: Judy and the Akira staff were friendly and great. And the food...! The food was amazing, especially the fresh nigiri and creative rolls. The scallop/ankimo/uni/quail egg spoons were off the hook. The NATTO roll was legit. The seared salmon belly roll, Atlantic, and Spicy mango was also the bomb. The kakuni pork belly with a side of rice hit the spot. And lastly the green tea cheesecake and black sesame ice cream is super lovely. The prices are very reasonable. Can't wait to try their bento box, donburi, and noodles next time. Wishing Judy and her husband the best! My new favorite spot in the city.
author: Claudia L.

description: Small, comfortable little restaurant; attentive service, modest menu. The rolls we had were not as flavorful as I had hoped but I really liked the appetizers we had (tori karaage and squid). Good sake and beverage selection. Would repeat.
author: Will H.

description:
3 stars = "A-OK."... that about sums it up. I think Japanese food is one category where high reviews on Yelp really can't be trusted, and this is a perfect example. It wasn't BAD, but it wasn't GOOD. It's exactly what you would have expected from a "Japanese" (quotes intentional) restaurant in SF prior to the opening of more authentic and legit restaurants in recent years. It's in fact better than most of those places, and some of the dishes are a priced very fairly. However, I made the mistake of expecting them to have some of their "over rice" items such as the chirashi during the dinner service, and upon discovering that they don't, made the immediate uneducated decision of adding the sashmi moriawase (combination) for $45. That's $3 a piece of fairly "basic" fish, and a huge chunk of my final bill. Fail. This is one of those restaurants where clientele will remark such things as "they give you thick pieces of fish there and it's fresh!", which just shows me that they don't really "get" Japanese food. /End snobby rant.

Maybe I'll come back some day during their lunch service and try some less ingredient-centric items and get a better value for my money there.
author: Kazu O.

description: Have been to it twice. Both times sushi tasted fresh. Above average taste but not amazing. I did try toro roll but was not impressed.
author: Jc B.

description: Great sushi, great service, great atmosphere and great prices for what you get. Will definitely be back next time I need sushi! We got the pink dragon and it was so good we picked up a second one before we left!
author: Sean H.

description:
I just have to give them five stars I'm from out of town I eat sushi all over the country when I travel and this was a very good place very classy reasonably priced
 the fish was so fresh and I loved sitting at the bar and watching the sushi chef do his thing
author: Cherlyn E.

description: The best Japanese food I've ever had and I love sushi. The waitress told us the best place was the low sushi bar and we loved to  watch the sushi chef making the most beautiful food. We loved everything we got and had a great chat with our waiter about how great Detroit is these days. Every time we are back in SF we'll stop here.
author: Suzanne P.

description: Avoid. We came here because of Yelp reviews. Staff is friendly, but... The dishes are not worth the wait, neither the money that is being charged for them. They look good but taste horrible. Windows are kept open making almost everyone wear their jackets (we kept our gear on just like when we eat in ski resorts). The tempura was at best average, the sushis had a bad 'fishy' / 'beurk' / ' yucky' taste (not the freshness you expect from such), the mochis were as good as you can get from a supermarket
author: Laszlo K.

description:
After being "rejected" at Zushi Puzzle, "ignored" at Kin Sho Bo (the new one on Lombard), we Yelped and found Akira.

Even though they were super busy on a Saturday night, and we didn't have a reservation they found us a place at the sushi bar in less than 10 minutes. 

The sushi was first-rate, the rolls creative, the nigiri well-cut and prepared by two "real" and experienced chefs (one for nigiri, the other for rolls.)

Most importantly the service was friendly.

Great neighborhood spot that we likely passed many times. We'll be back!
author: Dennis S.

description:
Starting from the appearance of the interior, this restaurant has a very formal and sophisticated feeling. Very relaxed and calm environment.

The food was delicious. The duck breast was nice and tender. The salmon, albacore, hamachi, and tuna sashimi were very fresh. My favorites were the tempura rolls which had shrimp tempura and unagi  which added a crispy texture with a sweet taste. The mango rolls were also amazing again with the sweetness of the mango with the fish.
author: Ricky H.

description: Everything about this place is amazing! The service is excellent. The food is superb! The spoons with scallop, quail egg, monk fish liver, and uni is a MUST ORDER. It was so good, we ordered it twice. We also ordered everything on the "specials" menu as nigiri... that toro is melt in your mouth good ... will be back to try the omakase one day
author: Nicole S.

description: Best sushi restaurant I have been to in sf! First sushi restaraunt I have ever gone to where not only the fish but the whole roll melts in your mouth. There isn't a whole lot of choices but no matter what role you get you will be happy.
author: Zach T.

description: The Unagi Don is really good for lunch. kalbi is the BBQ ribs with special souce. We really like our lunch here.
author: Vini Z.

description: All and all this is a great place. We opted for the chef's platter of sashimi. The fish was fresh and melted in the mouth (but everything on the platter was on the creamy side, would have been nice to also include something more firm for contrast). The hamachi special cold appetizer was delicious, and so were the uni+scallop+monkfish spoons. But the other savory warm small plates are a bit of a hit or miss. The grilled squid was bland (and texturally unsuccessful) and could have used some acid; the fried chicken is not as crispy as elsewhere. I would stick to the sashimi, sushi and cold fish items next time, as that's their strongest point.
author: George A.

description: Akira's Omakase Menu was FANTASTIC!   Out of this world.  Each of their 7 courses were delectable and the service was excellent.  We sat at the sushi bar so that we could watch the professional chefs prepare the dishes.  We coupled our meal with a bottle of dry sake and a couple beers.  Girlfriend also loved it.  Will definitely put on the top of my list as far as SF sushi places go.  Can't wait to go back.
author: Vince R.

description: The service was absolutely AMAZING!!! Wow!!! Everyone form the waitress to the sushi chef and the owner were there providing the most personable experience possible! Not to mention the food! It was fresh and completely exquisite. I will DEFINITELY be back when I'm in San Francisco again. I hope they open a place in Arizona because it would be my favorite sushi place.
author: Mari G.

description:
Japan in the City!
Take the Chefs recommendations and you won't go wrong.  This is a great addition to the neighborhood. Super duper fresh!
Must try the Black Sesame ice cream.
Stop reading and go eat.
author: Victor n.

description:
I live within walking distance of Akira, so when I saw that all the construction and remodeling was finally complete, I was very excited to try it! The interior of the restaurant is nicely decorated, so I can tell the owners really tried to make it look elegant. (Didn't get a chance to check out the restroom.) The restaurant itself is pretty spacious but doesn't offer lots of seating--maybe 20 people (not including bar seating). The inside of the restaurant was cold (but it's also been cold in SF recently). Servers were very attentive and friendly; chefs were friendly as well! When my boyfriend and I first arrived, there was only one other party, but as we left, three other parties were seated. 

Now on to the food . . . Food was averagely priced--not too pricey but also not too cheap. We ordered three rolls one nigiri and the total came out to about $45. My boyfriend and I were big fans of the tempura roll! The unagi nigiri was also good, but the two other rolls were just ok. My boyfriend thought the fish were too cold when it was served to us, but again, it may have just been because the whole restaurant (and city) were cold. 

Akira is still relatively new in a predominantly residential area, but once the word gets out, I'm sure it'll be packed in no time--I'd come back again to support a local business!
author: Jessilyn C.

description: Amazing place! The chef gave me samples of sashimi and was very kind and passionate about his work! Definitely recommend coming early because it gets packed. My first sushi experience in San Fransisco and will be a reoccurring spot. I never write reviews, this is worth it.
author: Johnny L.

description: Awesome sushi. The chicken katsu was really good, as was the ceviche. Waiter was wl extremely helpful, and attentive without being overbearing.
author: Cayle H.

description:
The sushi Rolls are all good. 
Service is bad, slow from the waiter part. I ordered beef takaki from a Hot dish section and it came out ice cold, i'm not exaggerating, so i asked the waiter that i ordered a hot dish and he told me that this was how it is always served, smh. Any ways i asked if he can just change the order to Beef Teriakey, he went back to check and never came back for long time, unacceptable when everybody infront of you is eating and you sitting looking at them not knowing whether your order is coming or not. So finally it came. Beef teriakey was good, hot & i recommend it.
author: MIRELA P.

description: We ordered the black cod, two sushi rolls, and a kastu curry. The fish has not fresh and smelled very fishy. It was so bad that my glass of water adopted the fishy smell all throughout dinner, so it served as a constant reminder of the way their fish had been stored. The pork inside the katsu was dense, tough, and dry. Everything else was average. Considering that this restaurant is so close to Japantown, there is no excuse for serving subpar, non-fresh food. Any one of the restaurants in Japantown can top this one easily.
author: Ryan L.

description: Akira is amazing! I'm back home in NYC now, and I'm still thinking about the great experience that I had here. My boyfriend and I came here on a busy weekday evening kind of expecting a wait given the amount of positive reviews, but we got seated at the bar pretty quickly and got to watch the chefs work their magic! We ordered a few rolls and the quality of the fish is superb. I'm definitely looking forward to my next visit to SF so I can come here again.
author: Lisa L.

description: The sushi was fresh and very tasty. Service was also excellent, very attentive and my water glass was never empty. The food presentation blows away other Japanese restaurant in SF. Ordered the omakase and there was not one dish I did not enjoy. Very nice setting ideal for family or a date. Will be coming back!
author: tai n.

description: Found this place on Yelp and so happy we did! Best sushi we've had in a long long time. We ordered several rolls, all of which were amazing. Our favorite was the Pink Dragon-highly recommend! Also, the service was on point and it's just so cozy. Cannot wait to go back!
author: Claudia J.

description: Decided to try their sushi with all the good reviews and I must say I was disappointed. The rolls are decent but the sashimi and nigiri was just mediocre quality and not really fresh. The worst dish of the night  for my party was the uni because it was bitter.  It appears that both the chef and staff are not Japanese.  Therefore, the standard of quality is not high. It was at least a clean restaurant but likely won't be going back.
author: Mary L.

description: i've been going to Akira since they've opened 2 years ago and can attest to the quality and service they provide. the owner is incredibly friendly and takes great care of his customers. not to mention some of the best sushi in town
author: Vik K.

description: Awesome sushi. Chill environment. Sushi chef is funny and meticulous. Great value too.
author: Super C.

description: This sushi restaurant is amazing! Andre, our server, was so personable and helpful. Minh, the chef, served the most delicious sushi I've had in years. The subtle flavors, the homemade soy sauce, the menu options, all of it made for a wonderful eating experience. We will definitely be coming back for more. We've eaten at Sushi Ran and this restaurant blows it away!
author: Erika M.

description: Awesome spot - they fly Toro in from Japan, it actually melts in your mouth. Rolls are on the small side but reasonably priced and delicious. Highly recommend!
author: Alex G.

description: Good sushi, particularly the fish from Japan - hon maguro, hamachi belly, etc.  Liked all the food, both kitchen and sushi bar.  Service was good, chef was personable.  Nice environment, lights were a little bright around the sushi bar but corrected as soon as we mentioned it.  Pretty good value overall.  Will definitely go back.
author: Glenn S.

description:
Very polite host. 

The sushi rolls were amazing. 
Try the dragon roll. 

The spicy tuna roll ! 

Nice environment. I recommend making a reservation.
author: Frank O.

description: Wow, best sushi restaurant in the City. Everything was delicious.  Great service. The chef is very sweet and personable.  Clean and nice space. Will be back!
author: Cindy W.

description: Amazing japanese restaurants! Wow I was so impress... great quality of food, incredible service, super cool place! I will be back for sure soon!
author: Nathalie M.

description: So good! Was there a month ago and left this in my drafts, but worth whatever wait you have to have. Had a salad with tempura bluefin for appetizer and the special peacock roll, I was stuffed! (And I'm a big guy). Lovely atmosphere and service.
author: Mike L.

description: I wish I can be a regular at this place. The service is great but the prep time takes way, way, way too long. (More than 25 mins)
author: Vivien S.

description: Love, Love, Love!!! By far the best Japanese food after my favorites: Shubui's in Miami, Florida and Etcétera in Costa Mesa, California. Restaurant is small, so you must wait to be seated. However, very worth the wait. Sushi rolls made to perfection, ambiance is cozy, lovely place. Clean, bathroom included. Will come back, when back in the area.
author: Katherine D.

description: Don't go to this restaurant especially during the weekend's night. The service is really bad. My friends and I asked for three times for to go and no one even gives the menu for us.
author: Aimee Z.

description: The food there was so good, I love the sushi and fish. The place is easy to find and the most important one is the price is reasonable!
author: Wei Q.

description: First time here. Delicious! Service is fantastic! Omakace for lunch = yes!! I absolutely recommend eating here. No regrets what so ever. Hamachi carpaccio is amazing!
author: M T.

description: Yum!!!! So delicious. Can't believe it took me so long to get here! It's a small cozy joint.  Feels casual.  Staff is super friendly and attentive.  Food is excellent.
author: Kristi R.

description: This was, without a doubt, the best sushi I've ever had. It may be a little pricier than the train places, but it is worth the extra cost. This is a small place, only 9 tables and a handful of bar seats, so on a busy night you may want reservations. The hamachi toro is to die for. If you have any questions whatsoever, Chef Min, Judy, and staff are very friendly and knowledgeable, and it's clear that Chef Min loves what he does. I'm visiting from Oregon and would literally come back to the Bay Area just to eat here again.
author: Eric K.

description: This place is pretty good for a casual lunch. We ordered a bento to share with sashimi and mixed tempura as well as an agedashi tofu (which was fabulous). The service was great and we ended up spending $36 tax included. All in all a lovely joint.
author: Ryan J.

description: Favorite sushi in SF. The only place I want to go after our Japan trip. The fish is so amazing and fresh.
author: Sarah G.

description: Very friendly and efficient staff. Beautifully presented food. Love that they have so many cooked options for the dinner guests who aren't into sushi. The sushi is not the quality of Saru/Ijji/Juni but fine for lunch. Love the bar seating.
author: Marina N.

description: It was a very good meal with the family. We did not have reservations but luckily made it before the dinner rush. It's not a big place. My kids enjoyed their caterpillars rolls while I ordered various rolls and nigiri sushi. Nabeyaki udon was other entree we ordered.
author: Henry C.

description: Veggie sushi is decent. Nice neighborhood spot. Would not travel out of my way to go though.
author: Aaron S.

description: Best sushi I've had in SF! Reasonably priced and takes reservations, which is rare for the city. Great quality food and service. Andre, our server is the man. Always recommend this place to friends visiting.
author: Sam H.

description: My first review and first time here.  Not afraid to give 5 stars to great service and food.  I was looking for new places to try around the neighborhood and was craving sushi.  I had the sushi lunch combination plate with a nice cold one.  Will definitely come again!
author: Naya C.

description: Good service. We ordered a lot and we liked it except from there rainbow sushi. The raw fish tastes old tho.
author: Shai B.

description:
We have just returned from AKIRA restaurant on Bush Street where we had dinner spontaneously because we were late after a long touristic day on our holiday through California.
We are totally overwhelmed by the friendliness and the extremely good quality of food we've had. 
Had a super sympathetic talk to the owner and the chef was more than generous to us.
I warmly recommend this restaurant to all who love Japanese food.
author: Heike R.

description: The fish was really fresh and great. Ambience was also good. I got the chirashi bowl and it was yummy. It is also so cheap for the quality
author: Martha S.

description: This is a very solid Japanese restaurant with friendly staff and good food. Everything we ordered was fresh, well presented, and not overpriced. The fish was super fresh and tasty. We sat at the bar and leisurely had a great lunch. A solid recommendation for this place.
author: Debbie S.

description: Toro was NOT fresh and left a foul taste in my mouth for many hours after the meal. Service was also pretty bad because the restaurant was busy.
author: Bobby D.

description: AMAZING FOOD!! Fish is as fresh as I have ever had in a sushi restaurant. The otoro is the way to go...again simply amazing!!
author: Alex R.

description: This is the best Japanese restaurant in the city!  The food is fantastic, it's very cozy and the staff is friendly and very attentive.  Try it!
author: Ann K.

description: I'm a bit surprised by all of the good reviews.  The good: great ambience and service.  The bad: we noticed that a lot of the fish tasted fishy and not fresh.  We also had to send a halibut nigiri back because I could literally not bite through it.  I was also confused about the rave reviews for some of the rolls like the mango roll.  The mango of as sliced so thin, you couldn't taste it...the roll was very mediocre.  With all of the great sushi restaurants in the city, I'll be surprised if this place stays in business.
author: Michelle C.

description: I stumbled upon this place and what a find. The sushi is extremely fresh and the presentation is very creative.  The setting is nice and relaxed. The chef has over 20 years of experience, which shows in his creative presentations.
author: Julie M.

description: Just try one roll negi Hama, but as my three years experience working at Japanese restaurant, it's worth to come here if u live or around this neighborhood! Food is not that pricy to this nice quality.
author: Sunny W.

description: Everything we ordered was very delicious. I would recommend the Uni/Egg/Ankimo spoons and the yellow tail carpaccio. Also nice ambience.
author: Ioanna B.

description: Thank you Akira for a lovely dining experience.  The tempura, seaweed salad, salmon belly roll.... and oh! Let's not forget the quail egg/scallop/uni spoons!!! All were soooo delicious!
author: Julie I.

description: Found Akira on Yelp, went for it.  Had about a half hour wait on a Saturday night on a holiday weekend.  Worth every minute!  It's a small establishment and was a little cramped and loud but again, worth it.  Sushi was exceptional and I've been craving it ever since!
author: Mallory C.

description: I tried Akira last weekend - I went early (6pm) without a reservation, and the place was already buzzing! But the hostess was very gracious and was able to accommodate us. So, next time, I'll make reservations for sure, even for 2 people! Food and service were excellent! Our grilled asparagus appetizer was amazing, and the fish was buttery-soft and super fresh. We stayed for dessert and enjoyed the green tea cheesecake and sesame ice cream. Each came with a sweet bean on top as garnish - ate that as well! Very friendly and attentive staff. So happy to have another sushi option in my neighborhood!
author: Barbara K.

description:
Came here for dinner on Valentine's Day because Yelpers rate it so highly. The ambience was relaxing, the "kaiseki-style" presentation of the food was charming and the service was friendly. If you strip away all these surface qualities, however, you'll find that the food itself is only so-so 

Akira tries hard to be authentic, but in the end it's just an above average Californian Japanese restaurant (I'll admit to being something of a Japanese food snob because I spent a lot of time in Japan and Asia and had plenty of great Japanese food). We had the Omakase dinner. The three small appetizers were OK but nothing to write home about. The sashimi was thickly-cut and bland. The sushi wasn't memorable because the vinegared rice lacked texture and taste. The soup tasted similar to my home-made miso soup. I barely noticed the simmered beef dish.

When the mediocrity of the food became apparent to us, we looked around to examine the clientele. I don't think there were any Japanese there, which didn't surprise us.

While our overall experience at Akira wasn't bad, we won't be coming back because the food was so ordinary.
author: George C.

description: Great neighborhood sushi spot! Came here at 5:45 on a Monday and it was quiet, but quickly filled up in the couple hours we were there. Nice service, great sushi, real snow crab in the California rolls. I am celiac and they were very accommodating for Gluten Free, including bringing my own gf soy sauce.
author: Katrina G.

description: Amazing food and GREAT customer service. I sat at the sushi bar and the chefs were beyond nice and took great pride in their work. Mins San was the happiest and created a work of art in every dish! Thank you San Francisco for the experience!
author: Kaelyn B.

description:
This place opened up a block from our house so we were pretty stoked! The Menu was interested with new items I haven't seen before at Japanese places. 

The duck appetizer was amazing.

The raw oysters were some of the best I've had in SF.

Miso soup was... different. Not to my taste but my boyfriend liked it.

Will definitely come back soon!
author: Ann B.

description:
Went to Akira last night and thought it was just okay.  Perhaps, given the high yelp rating, my expectations were higher than normal but I was not particular impressed by anything.  3 yelp stars for being relatively average. 

Notables: 
We had the oyster uni shooters which turned out to be more sake than anything else. There was a little uni and oystered bit in there but they were drowning in the sake. Maybe rebrand as salted sake shot? 

The service was good. Our waitress was nice and attentive.
author: John S.

description: What an great sushi experience!  The sushi chef/owner was so friendly and engaging.  He took so much care in everything he made and it came out in the taste.  Great ambiance, reasonably priced, and wonderful service.  Highly recommend!
author: Ene S.

description: Great to have found this spot! Loved the spoons with urchin, quail egg, ankimo and scallops, loved the seared salmon appetizer and the miso black cod. All in all, a great addition to Lower Pac Heights area.
author: Olga A.

description: Overall my new favorite place is SF!! Yum. Fresh fish and great presentation, service was good too. Portions aren't large but ok for the price.. but they charge extra for the rice tea which is annoying.
author: Alpo P.

description: Although the food was quite good, and the service was mostly good, the waiter fell short in the end. First off, I am allergic to soy, usually a non issue with sushi but I made sure to talk to him at the outset about it since some sauces contain soy. Three of us ordered several rolls and nigiri which we enjoyed. As a spurge, we ordered one last roll, their special spider roll for which we waited, no exaggeration, over 20 minutes. When it arrived, it was clearly covered by a soy based sauce. My husband asked him about it and reminded him of my allergy. The waiter acted like he got caught in an uncomfortable position. It was in fact soy and that he "forgot" to mention it to the appropriate person. No apology, no couple bucks off, nothing in place of it for me. Nada. He blew the opportunity to make things right. Return visits are unlikely .
author: Laurie P.

description: Favorite local sushi spot. All of the rolls are delicious, great service, and easy to walk in and get a table.
author: Kay A.

description: The food was really good, service nice, and reasonable  prices. I will definitely go again and place is clean and a change from other sushi places.
author: N A.

description: I went there for lunch. Service was the best. Waiter is so friendly. The food is not bad.
author: Pandora P.

description: The food is innovative and good. Particularly salmon belly. Also not really a discovered place, so the wait times are not that high thankfully. Great place overall!
author: Ankan S.

description: Stumbled on this cozy sushi spot for a late dinner while visiting SF from Sacramento. Great food, highly attentive service and a pleasant ambiance. I would highly recommend this spot for an intimate date with great sushi!
author: Chris B.

description:
This place used to be called Ah Lins. The atmosphere is quite nice and definitely has a "fancy" feel to it, and the servers are attentive and approachable (though it's probably because there's only a few customers). 

The food was just average considering the cost. We ordered one vegetarian tempura maki (which was pretty good!), and two fish rolls. The food alone I rate 3 stars because of how cold the fish was served. It seemed like the cheif just took out the fish from the fridge, sliced it up, and put it onto the rice. 

I wish nothing but success for this restaurant, and hope it does well, but they need to work on the quality of the food
author: Wilson H.

description: Great little spot in the neighborhood. Akira has fresh and delicious sushi with some great specials. Loved the hamachi with avocado, shaved mango with truffle oil. We sat at the bar our second time and had a great conversation with the sushi chef, who also happens to be part owner. Akira is one of our favorite restaurants in SF!
author: Anish B.

description: I gave 3 stars because the service was awful. I came here for lunch because of the great Yelp reviews and while the food was good, the waiter left a bad impression. While ordering it felt like I was bothering him. He was rushing off before I could even finish my order. Forget about asking him questions. He was not helpful at all. He would drop my food on the other side of the table and never asked me if I needed anything such as a spoon for my soup. I had to flag him down. He didn't seem to have this issue with other customers so maybe it was just me. Who knows. I do know they need more than one server so this guy isn't running around sweating all over the place and being unfriendly. Doubt I'll go back.
author: Cassy S.

description: What a wonderful addition to the neighbors hood- great tasting sushi, high quality fish, reasonably priced and above all friendly service and genuine care for the customers!  I recommend the Omakase- at $65 it is well worth it! Also enjoyed some great cuts of Toro, Hamachi, and Walu. My favorite dish was a seared swordfish that was part of the omakase. We will definitely be returning here!
author: Katherine C.

description: this is the best sushi i've had in a minute!!! service was so good, everyone was very friendly. i recommend sitting at the bar so you can watch the rolls be made. we ordered caterpillar and dragon rolls, both so amazing, and complex with the flavors. 10/10 recommend!!!
author: Madi G.

description: Their service was amazing, very friendly and kind. The fish is fresh and very clean!!! This is a hidden gem I just found that opened up two months ago. New favorite sushi spot!
author: Shimmy S.

description: Sushi was great. It was pricey ($100 for 2 without alcohol) which adds to my overall disdain with the lack of delicious AND affordable sushi in SF.  Not a reason to deduct stars from Akira, so maybe I'll be back for lunch.
author: Janelle F.

description: My girlfriend and I consider ourselves to be pretty decent sushi critics and typically eat it once or twice a week at different restaurants in San Francisco and during our travels.  We were excited to try this place when it opened around the corner from us.   We were both very impressed with the quality of the fish and the creativity of the chefs.  The staff was very attentive and the overall atmosphere of the restaurant is great.  We are excited to continue coming back here and are adding it to our rotation.
author: Matt M.

description: Went for lunch on a Monday. Really nice atmosphere and staff. Ordered Miso soup, Tempura, and the Pink Dragon which is a specialty roll. The Pink Dragon was the highlight of my meal. If you're looking for something a little different with a lot of flavor that's the roll for you. Would highly recommend
author: Jasmin M.

description: In the land of surprisingly subpar over priced sushi I think I've found the exception and prize I've been looking for. This place is amazing - fresh fish, amazing special menu with delicacies from Japan, vey reasonably priced and did I mention fresh? The staff is nice, the ambience is adorable and I couldn't ask for anything more. Loved the uni, futo maki, salmon sashimi, shrimp tempura, spider roll (yes I ate everything). Here's the deal - this isn't going to be a nobu or morimoto like experience. This is a go to place for spectacular fresh sushi that you visit every week for the rest of your life. You can pretty much skip every other sushi place within a 10 mile radius from now on because despite their 4 star reviews online they are really subpar and expensive (you know who you are).
author: L L.

description: Food was just okay. Nothing bad, nothing great. We had a mix of nigiri, rolls, and apps. Really nice service though.
author: Keiko S.

description: First sushi in San Francisco and I have to say I was not impressed. The quality was average compared to where I am from but at a higher price and very small quantity, I should have followed my gut cause I could smell all the fish when I opened the door, they also messed up our order on top of all that
author: Brenden L.

description: What a gem!  Really good high quality sushi in a nice atmosphere.  The uni quail egg scallop was amazing. I will be coming back.
author: mike s.

description:
Akira is an amazing Japanese Restuarant from the friendly reception and service to the comfortable environment and excellent menu. Sushi, sashimi, etc is fresh daily and exquisitely prepared.

Not to miss‼
author: John S.

description: We had a great lunch here. Sashimi and spicy black cod was delicious and the service was super friendly and accommodating!  Will definitely go back!
author: Janette G.

description: Definitely expected more.  The food was pretty good, but not 4.5-stars-good like other reviews stated.  I did like the diversity of the menu - lots of nigiri, rolls, and cooked food options.  All of the cooked food (yummy duck!) was really good, but the quality of the fish in the sushi could have been better.
author: Roberta V.

description:
Wow! One word to describe Akira Japanese restaurant as a whole. From greetings at the door by smiling staff to the open concept of the Sushi Bar with Chef Minh precisely cutting fish and rolling the sushi rolls, I can say I felt really welcoming my first time here. My girlfriend and I were seated quickly which is always a plus! The table setting was really nice. I was very impressed with the rolled warm towels set at our table to wipe and clean our hands. The tea cups and plates has nice design. 

Food was amazing! We ordered the 7 course Omakase and the tempura roll. The 7 course Omakase is chef's choice which can never go wrong. The fish was fresh, each course was decorated uniquely. Tempura roll was bomb! Crispy and perfectly rolled. 
(This restaurant even have their own self-named Akira Roll!)

Overall, the restaurant is very clean and modern. The choice of hardwood floors, the lights, and paint color all flows together very nicely. The lighting is dim, sets for a romantic dinner. Not too loud and not too quiet. Lastly, the bathroom! Kind of odd to point out but this was the cherry on top to the restaurant in my opinion. Very clean, candles lit, very modern.
author: Wil H.

description: A welcome addition to the neighborhood! I've been to Akira for lunch twice and hope to try the dinner menu soon. The fish is fresh and properly cut, the Chirashi includes delicious house made pickled mushrooms and all the rolls we tried were tasty and well crafted.
author: Hannah S.

description: Great neighborhood Japanese restaurant. Fresh fish imported from Japan. Loved the sashimi specials and the bitesize scallop appetizer served in a spoon. A much better option than its competitors in Japantown. I prefer the bar seatings to watch the chefs in action.
author: Sylvie W.

description: Our favorite local sushi spot! My favorite is the pink dragon and friend spicy sushi roll. The staff is so friendly and accommodating. The sushi chefs are awesome too! It's usually packed so try to call ahead of you can.
author: Ari F.

description:
This place has quickly become my go to neighborhood sushi spot.  

The sushi is reasonably priced, fresh and tasty.  They also have a nice array of cold and hot appetizers if you aren't in the mood for sushi.  The service is great.  There is a good staff to patron ratio and they are clearly trying to be customer friendly.
author: Alissa D.

description: 3 rolls and the most tasteless miso for $50. Way too loud, staff totally confused, food mediocre at best.
author: Lucy M.

description: I feel like this is one of those places with high review that unfortunately dont live up to its praise from time to time. Food was good. I really liked the seared salmon belly. We sat at the table right next to the door, unfortunately. Draft is very bad when someone opens the door. Although its a small restaurant with 3 servers, they got pretty busy and attentiveness of the staff got lost especially to our side. Despite calling and getting the waitress' attention to order an additional item, she didnt come back until after 10min. Another thing we didnt like was that the linen napkin was very old and messed up our clothes leaving moults. we were actually disgusted by that!!!
author: Duke B.

description: New neighborhood spot- lovely interior and attentive servers. Had the tempura udon soup on a cold night- hit the spot! Good hot sake also helps- need to explore more - great sushi awaits!
author: Helen M.

description: I love this place so much I almost don't want to leave a review out of fear it will get too crowded! The chef is classically trained and the fish is super fresh. The best deal is their bento box lunch special. You won't get a better box of food anywhere else in the city unless you go to Kyoto!
author: columbia s.

description:
Beautiful. And delicious. This place is a new gem.
We loved the specials, especially the mushroom soup served in a pot ... so delicate and delicious.
author: Martha A.

description: Best sushi in San Francisco! Incredibly fresh fish (the owner mentioned a lot of it is flown in from Japan) and a few takes on sushi I've never seen before in the city. Spicy Mango roll and Kobe beef roll were super tasty. All of the Nigiri was on point (scallop and baby hamachi are must try). The owners are really nice and energetic and the staff was great as well. I'm looking forward to trying the lunch menu.
author: Seth A.

description: I came here for a going away party for my manager today and was blown away by the food and service. We started with some sushi rolls. We ordered some of their daily specials. The caterpillar, the Kobe dragon roll, and the seared salmon belly. The caterpillar roll was pretty standard and has always been one of my favorites at most sushi places. The Kobe dragon roll and the seared salmon belly were very unique and I'm already craving more! We finished it off with some Udon and I can say that I regret sharing it with my coworker because before we knew it we reached the bottom of the bowl. *endless tears* I can't wait to go back and eat here again. Again the service here is very attentive and they are very sweet.
author: J H.

description: We were here my daughter and me on a quick getaway. Found this place close to our hotel. Walked down there and love the ambience, small place with great service. Love the chef super fresh food.
author: Zoraya L.

description: This is hands down one of the best sushi places in the neighborhood, including Japantown. Aside from Sushi An in the Peace Plaza, which is more for special occasions due to the price, I haven't really found another good sushi place nearby. Akira definitely fills a void, and the owner Minh is super friendly. Highly recommend the pink dragon roll and black sesame ice cream. The restaurant can get a bit drafty, so my only advice is to bring a sweater. All in all, I'm so happy this opened up in the neighborhood, and I'm definitely going to be a regular!
author: Cat N.

description: A group of us girls took our best friend to sushi for her birthday. We just yelped a couple of places near our hotel and stumbled upon Akira...boy were we in shock. This place is UNBELIEVABLE. We all left saying it was the best sushi we've ever tasted (we can be harsh sushi critics). It was melt in your mouth good. Not to mention the incredible staff and chefs that work there. They make sure you feel like family and enjoy your experience. Thank you for an incredible dinner experience - we've already told so many people about this place!
author: Sami S.

description:
On first impression, Akira is a small, cozy, beautiful restaurant with very attentive, friendly staff and chefs. Very nice detail to the utensils, plates, tea mugs, hot towels. On arriving ,we were asked if we were warm enough, and promptly bright out a space heater for our use.

The food itself was wonderful. We ordered the tempura, caterpillar, cherry blossom, dragon, rainbow, as well as sashimi and barracuda sashimi. I love sushi but admittedly don't have the most refined palate, but from my own past experience, the fish was fresh, the rice was a perfect consistency, and I especially appreciated that the sauce for the dragon roll was light as to not detract from the unagi. One friend in our party who worked at a sushi restaurant also remarked that the food was excellent, and was told that Akita receives shipments of fish on a daily basis, so rest assured the fish is consistently fresh.

To finish off, we were given complementary dessert (sesame ice cream garnished with some puffed rice and sweet black bean). Again, clear attention to detail.

Akira is a welcome new addition to the neighborhood, and it's clear that they're here to earn their business and respect. You will love it if you're looking for a restaurant with great service without coming off as stuffy. If they continue down this road I expect they will be here for years to come. We will be back!
author: C L.

description: We loved this place, the food was delicious, extreamly cozy ambient and the owner was fabulous with us. We where visiting from Argentina and ended marveled
author: Diego B.

description: Awesome quality, serve ware, and decor. Cod was perfect as well as everything else I had ( duck appetizer,  udon, caterpillar roll, salmon belly, miso).  Service was top notch and atmosphere made me want to make this a definite date spot.  Well done!
author: Russell D.

description:
I rarely take the time to write reviews on yelp, but our experience warrants one.
I called and made a reservation the day before. When we arrived, they said they didn't have it and wouldn't even acknowledge it.
I even showed the hostess my call history and said I spoke with a man at a given time.
She went ahead and sat walk ins before us and was very condescending.
Our waiter was no where to be found all night, and the sushi got worse as the place got more crowded.
The one star is for the sweet sushi chefs. Our first pieces were the best of the night, but then the people didn't know how to handle the faster pace required for bigger crowds.
The truffle carpaccio was awful but we couldn't bring ourselves to tell the chef. The fish was too cold and Carpaccio is meant to be thin slices. It was thick pieces alternated with thick pieces of avocado then poured on waaaaaay too much truffle oil. Plus, the presentation was a big thumbs down.
The craziest part, was we got our bill and it was missing half of our order!
We kindly let them know and no one, not the waiter, or even the manager who brought it back to us said thank you or even acknowledged the fact that we caught it.
I will not go back here. The fish quality was pretty decent but the management and staff were scattered and unprofessional.
author: natasha c.

description: Everything we had - tempura, chicken karaage, miso cod, asparagus - was a cut above most bento box/specialty roll places.
author: Valerie T.

description: Tried the $65 omakase. The red bean ice cream at the end was very tasty. The rest of the food ranged between decent and not so good. Next time would try something simpler or go somewhere else.
author: Jonathan P.

description: Just moved around the corner from Akira a month ago. We are big fans of sushi, but this was exceptional food. Anxious to try their set price lunch menu. We sat at the counter and watched and spoke to the chefs. Highly recommended
author: Tom B.

description: Its a new place in town, must try ! Super fresh seafood, excellent service. Can't ask for more.
author: B L.

description: By far the best sushi I've ever had, and I eat a lot of sushi. The owner was very nice and obviously passionate about serving only the best. The seared Salmon belly roll was incredible. So lightly seared that it's still raw, but the sear brings out all of the flavors. If you love sushi you absolutely must come here.
author: Steve G.

description: Quaint little spot with great sushi. Staff was great & attentive, and the sushi was dope. I wouldn't recommend it for non-sushi lovers (the dinner menu doesn't offer much for those who can't handle raw fish), but if you're looking for sushi this is the place.
author: Natalia N.

description: New favorite sushi restaurant! Amazing service, incredible quality! Would highly recommend!
author: Caetlynn H.

description: Visiting from out of town. Love sushi and this place is amazing! Great service. Sitting at the bar watching the Artist is a highlight!!
author: Meghan H.

description: One of the best sushi places I've been to in a while!  My fiance and I were celebrating our anniversary, and although they took reservations, we were late so we lost our spot.  The staff was still friendly and kept checking in with us to let us know how long the wait would be.  Everything we ordered was amazing!  Salmon sashimi, big eye tuna roll, Akira roll.. but my two absolute favorites were the Bluefin tuna belly Nigiri and the Cherry Blossom roll (tuna and salmon).  Melt in your mouth, super fresh, deliciousness.  Our server was amazing, he was really patient while we kept ordering additional food, and was always around for us when we needed anything.  Food came out very quickly, and with a smile.  All around great experience, and my our favorite sushi spot.
author: Lyra F.

description: This was surprisingly delicious! I live around the corner and was excited to see a new place and new ownership take over Ah Lin Chinese. The owners Judy and her husband were great and personable. The fish was fresh. We got the black cod and were not disappointed. It was perfectly cooked and buttery. The spicy tuna roll is spicy! Which I love. The pink dragon and spicy mango rolls were also wonderful. The price is decent - the reason it wasn't 5 (I would rate this 4.5) is I wish they had a few more creative rolls, but all in all this will definitely be one of our go to sushi places.
author: Meredith P.
